  16class JointType(Enum):
  17    """
  18    Enumeration of joint types used in MuJoCo simulations.
  19
  20    This class defines the types of joints that can be used in a MuJoCo simulation,
  21    including free, ball, slide, and hinge joints. These joint types are associated
  22    with integer values that are used within the MuJoCo framework to specify the type
  23    of joint for different elements of the model.
  24
  25    Attributes
  26    ----------
  27    FREE : int
  28        A joint that allows for unrestricted movement in all translational and rotational
  29        degrees of freedom. Represented by the integer value 0.
  30    BALL : int
  31        A ball-and-socket joint that allows rotation in all directions, but no translational
  32        movement. Represented by the integer value 1.
  33    SLIDE : int
  34        A prismatic joint that allows translational movement along a single axis, with no
  35        rotational freedom. Represented by the integer value 2.
  36    HINGE : int
  37        A rotational joint that allows rotation around a single axis, similar to a door hinge.
  38        Represented by the integer value 3.
  39    """
  40
  41    FREE = int(mj.mjtJoint.mjJNT_FREE)
  42    BALL = int(mj.mjtJoint.mjJNT_BALL)
  43    SLIDE = int(mj.mjtJoint.mjJNT_SLIDE)
  44    HINGE = int(mj.mjtJoint.mjJNT_HINGE)
  45
  46
  47class ObjType(Enum):
  48    """
  49    Enumeration of object types used in MuJoCo simulations.
  50
  51    This class defines various object types that can be used in a MuJoCo simulation,
  52    including bodies, joints, geoms, sites, actuators, and sensors. These object types
  53    are associated with integer values that are used within the MuJoCo framework to
  54    specify the type of object for different elements of the model.
  55
  56    Attributes
  57    ----------
  58    UNKNOWN : int
  59        Represents an unknown object type. Used when the object type is not recognized.
  60        Represented by the integer value 0.
  61    BODY : int
  62        Represents a body in the simulation. Bodies are rigid objects that can be connected
  63        by joints or other constraints. Represented by the integer value 1.
  64    XBODY : int
  65        Represents a body but used to access the regular frame instead of the i-frame.
  66        Represented by the integer value 2.
  67    JOINT : int
  68        Represents a joint that connects two bodies and allows for relative movement.
  69        Represented by the integer value 3.
  70    DOF : int
  71        Represents a degree of freedom (DOF) of a joint, typically used to describe the
  72        axes along which a joint can move or rotate. Represented by the integer value 4.
  73    GEOM : int
  74        Represents a geometric shape associated with a body, used for collision detection
  75        and visual rendering. Represented by the integer value 5.
  76    SITE : int
  77        Represents a site, which is a fixed point or frame on a body used for specifying
  78        positions or attaching sensors. Represented by the integer value 6.
  79    CAMERA : int
  80        Represents a camera, which can be used to render views of the simulation environment.
  81        Represented by the integer value 7.
  82    LIGHT : int
  83        Represents a light source in the simulation environment. Represented by the integer
  84        value 8.
  85    FLEX : int
  86        Represents a flex object, typically used in simulations of flexible materials.
  87        Represented by the integer value 9.
  88    MESH : int
  89        Represents a mesh object, typically a more complex geometric shape defined by vertices
  90        and faces. Represented by the integer value 10.
  91    SKIN : int
  92        Represents a skin, usually used for rendering soft or flexible outer surfaces on bodies.
  93        Represented by the integer value 11.
  94    HFIELD : int
  95        Represents a heightfield, typically used to model uneven terrain or surfaces in the
  96        simulation. Represented by the integer value 12.
  97    TEXTURE : int
  98        Represents a texture, which can be applied to geometric shapes for visual realism.
  99        Represented by the integer value 13.
 100    MATERIAL : int
 101        Represents a material for rendering, which defines visual properties like color and
 102        reflectiveness. Represented by the integer value 14.
 103    PAIR : int
 104        Represents a geom pair to include in the simulation for collision detection.
 105        Represented by the integer value 15.
 106    EXCLUDE : int
 107        Represents a body pair to exclude from collision detection. Represented by the integer
 108        value 16.
 109    EQUALITY : int
 110        Represents an equality constraint, used to enforce specific relationships between
 111        different elements in the simulation. Represented by the integer value 17.
 112    TENDON : int
 113        Represents a tendon, typically used to model soft structures or actuators in biological
 114        systems. Represented by the integer value 18.
 115    ACTUATOR : int
 116        Represents an actuator, which generates forces or torques to move bodies in the simulation.
 117        Represented by the integer value 19.
 118    SENSOR : int
 119        Represents a sensor, which is used to measure various aspects of the simulation such as
 120        positions, velocities, or forces. Represented by the integer value 20.
 121    NUMERIC : int
 122        Represents a numeric element, often used for user-defined values or parameters.
 123        Represented by the integer value 21.
 124    TEXT : int
 125        Represents a text element, used to store or display text in the simulation.
 126        Represented by the integer value 22.
 127    TUPLE : int
 128        Represents a tuple, often used to group multiple elements together.
 129        Represented by the integer value 23.
 130    KEY : int
 131        Represents a keyframe, used to save or restore the state of the simulation at specific
 132        points in time. Represented by the integer value 24.
 133    PLUGIN : int
 134        Represents a plugin instance, which can be used to extend the functionality of the
 135        simulation with user-defined code. Represented by the integer value 25.
 136    """
 137
 138    UNKNOWN = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_UNKNOWN)  # unknown object type
 139    BODY = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_BODY)  # body
 140    XBODY = int(
 141        mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_XBODY
 142    )  # body, used to access regular frame instead of i-frame
 143    JOINT = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_JOINT)  # joint
 144    DOF = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_DOF)  # dof
 145    GEOM = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_GEOM)  # geom
 146    SITE = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_SITE)  # site
 147    CAMERA = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_CAMERA)  # camera
 148    LIGHT = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_LIGHT)  # light
 149    FLEX = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_FLEX)  # flex
 150    MESH = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_MESH)  # mesh
 151    SKIN = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_SKIN)  # skin
 152    HFIELD = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_HFIELD)  # heightfield
 153    TEXTURE = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_TEXTURE)  # texture
 154    MATERIAL = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_MATERIAL)  # material for rendering
 155    PAIR = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_PAIR)  # geom pair to include
 156    EXCLUDE = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_EXCLUDE)  # body pair to exclude
 157    EQUALITY = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_EQUALITY)  # equality constraint
 158    TENDON = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_TENDON)  # tendon
 159    ACTUATOR = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_ACTUATOR)  # actuator
 160    SENSOR = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_SENSOR)  # sensor
 161    NUMERIC = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_NUMERIC)  # numeric
 162    TEXT = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_TEXT)  # text
 163    TUPLE = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_TUPLE)  # tuple
 164    KEY = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_KEY)  # keyframe
 165    PLUGIN = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_PLUGIN)  # plugin instance
 166    NOOBJECT = int(mj.mjtObj.mjNOBJECT)  # number of object types
 167    FRAME = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_FRAME)  # frame
 168

 170def get_number_of(model: mj.MjModel, obj_type: ObjType) -> int:
 171    """
 172    Retrieves the count of objects of a specified type in a MuJoCo model.
 173
 174    Parameters
 175    ----------
 176    model : mj.MjModel
 177        The MuJoCo model from which to count objects.
 178    obj_type : ObjType
 179        The type of objects to count, e.g., actuators, bodies, joints.
 180
 181    Returns
 182    -------
 183    int
 184        The number of objects of the specified type in the model.
 185
 186    Raises
 187    ------
 188    ValueError
 189        If the specified object type is not recognized.
 190    """
 191    type_to_attribute = {
 192        ObjType.ACTUATOR: model.nu,
 193        ObjType.BODY: model.nbody,
 194        ObjType.JOINT: model.njnt,
 195        ObjType.DOF: model.nv,
 196        ObjType.GEOM: model.ngeom,
 197        ObjType.SITE: model.nsite,
 198        ObjType.CAMERA: model.ncam,
 199        ObjType.LIGHT: model.nlight,
 200        ObjType.MESH: model.nmesh,
 201        ObjType.SKIN: model.nskin,
 202        ObjType.HFIELD: model.nhfield,
 203        ObjType.TEXTURE: model.ntex,
 204        ObjType.MATERIAL: model.nmat,
 205        ObjType.PAIR: model.npair,
 206        ObjType.EXCLUDE: model.nexclude,
 207        ObjType.EQUALITY: model.neq,
 208        ObjType.TENDON: model.ntendon,
 209        ObjType.SENSOR: model.nsensordata,
 210        ObjType.NUMERIC: model.nnumeric,
 211        ObjType.TEXT: model.ntext,
 212        ObjType.TUPLE: model.ntuple,
 213        ObjType.KEY: model.nkey,
 214        ObjType.PLUGIN: model.nplugin,
 215        ObjType.FRAME: 0,  # No direct model attribute
 216    }
 217
 218    if obj_type not in type_to_attribute:
 219        raise ValueError(f"Object type {obj_type} not recognized.")
 220
 221    return type_to_attribute[obj_type]
 222
 223
 224def get_names(model: mj.MjModel, obj_type: ObjType) -> List[str]:
 225    """
 226    Retrieves the names of all objects of a specified type in a MuJoCo model.
 227
 228    Parameters
 229    ----------
 230    model : mj.MjModel
 231        The MuJoCo model containing the objects.
 232    obj_type : ObjType
 233        The type of objects to retrieve names for, e.g., actuators, bodies.
 234
 235    Returns
 236    -------
 237    List[str]
 238        A list of names for all objects of the specified type in the model.
 239    """
 240    return [
 241        mj.mj_id2name(model, obj_type.value, id)
 242        for id in range(get_number_of(model, obj_type))
 243    ]
 244
 245
 246def get_ids(model: mj.MjModel, obj_type: ObjType) -> List[int]:
 247    """
 248    Retrieves the IDs of all objects of a specified type in a MuJoCo model.
 249
 250    Parameters
 251    ----------
 252    model : mj.MjModel
 253        The MuJoCo model containing the objects.
 254    obj_type : ObjType
 255        The type of objects to retrieve IDs for.
 256
 257    Returns
 258    -------
 259    List[int]
 260        A list of IDs for all objects of the specified type in the model.
 261    """
 262    return [i for i in range(get_number_of(model, obj_type))]

 265def name2id(model: mj.MjModel, name: str, obj_type: ObjType) -> int:
 266    """
 267    Retrieves the ID of an object by its name and type in a MuJoCo model.
 268
 269    Parameters
 270    ----------
 271    model : mj.MjModel
 272        The MuJoCo model containing the object.
 273    name : str
 274        The name of the object.
 275    obj_type : ObjType
 276        The type of the object, e.g., body, joint.
 277
 278    Returns
 279    -------
 280    int
 281        The ID of the object if it exists.
 282    """
 283    id = mj.mj_name2id(model, obj_type.value, name)
 284    assert does_exist(model, name, obj_type)
 285    return id

 288def id2name(model: mj.MjModel, id: int, obj_type: ObjType) -> str:
 289    """
 290    Retrieves the name of an object by its ID and type in a MuJoCo model.
 291
 292    Parameters
 293    ----------
 294    model : mj.MjModel
 295        The MuJoCo model containing the object.
 296    id : int
 297        The ID of the object.
 298    obj_type : ObjType
 299        The type of the object, e.g., actuator, site.
 300
 301    Returns
 302    -------
 303    str
 304        The name of the object if it exists.
 305    """
 306    name = mj.mj_id2name(model, obj_type.value, id)
 307    assert does_exist(model, id, obj_type)
 308    return name

 311def does_exist(
 312    model: mj.MjModel, identifier: Union[int, str], obj_type: ObjType
 313) -> bool:
 314    """
 315    Checks if an object with a given name or ID exists in a MuJoCo model.
 316
 317    Parameters
 318    ----------
 319    model : mj.MjModel
 320        The MuJoCo model to check within.
 321    identifier : int or str
 322        The ID or name of the object.
 323    obj_type : ObjType
 324        The type of the object, e.g., geom, sensor.
 325
 326    Returns
 327    -------
 328    bool
 329        True if the object exists, False otherwise.
 330
 331    Raises
 332    ------
 333    ValueError
 334        If the object type is unrecognized or if the specified identifier type is invalid.
 335    """
 336    if isinstance(identifier, str):
 337        exists = (
 338            True if mj.mj_name2id(model, obj_type.value, identifier) != -1 else False
 339        )
 340        if not exists:
 341            raise ValueError(
 342                f"{obj_type.name} name '{identifier}' not found in the model. The model contain the {obj_type.name}s {get_names(model, obj_type)}"
 343            )
 344    elif isinstance(identifier, int):
 345        exists = (
 346            True
 347            if mj.mj_id2name(model, obj_type.value, identifier) is not None
 348            else False
 349        )
 350        if not exists:
 351            raise ValueError(
 352                f"{obj_type.name} id '{identifier}' not found in the model. The model contain the {obj_type.name}s {get_ids(model, obj_type)}"
 353            )
 354    else:
 355        raise ValueError(
 356            f"Invalid type input id with value '{identifier}' and type {type(identifier)} use either string or int."
 357        )
 358    return exists
 359

 361def get_pose(
 362    model: mj.MjModel, data: mj.MjData, identifier: Union[int, str], obj_type: ObjType
 363) -> sm.SE3:
 364    """
 365    Retrieves the pose (position and orientation) of an object in a MuJoCo model.
 366
 367    Parameters
 368    ----------
 369    model : mj.MjModel
 370        The MuJoCo model containing the object.
 371    data : mj.MjData
 372        The simulation data containing the pose information.
 373    identifier : int or str
 374        The ID or name of the object.
 375    obj_type : ObjType
 376        The type of the object, e.g., body, site, camera.
 377
 378    Returns
 379    -------
 380    sm.SE3
 381        The pose of the object as an SE3 transformation matrix.
 382
 383    Raises
 384    ------
 385    ValueError
 386        If the object type does not support pose retrieval.
 387    """
 388
 389    if not does_exist(model, identifier, obj_type):
 390        return sm.SE3()
 391
 392    # Define a mapping for types that can provide poses
 393    pose_mapping = {
 394        ObjType.ACTUATOR: data.actuator,
 395        ObjType.BODY: data.body,
 396        ObjType.JOINT: data.joint,
 397        ObjType.GEOM: data.geom,
 398        ObjType.SITE: data.site,
 399        ObjType.CAMERA: data.cam,
 400        ObjType.LIGHT: data.light,
 401    }
 402
 403    # Check if type has a pose; raise an error if it does not
 404    if obj_type not in pose_mapping:
 405        raise ValueError(f"obj_type {obj_type.name} cannot provide a pose...")
 406
 407    if (
 408        (obj_type is ObjType.CAMERA)
 409        or (obj_type is ObjType.SITE)
 410        or (obj_type is ObjType.GEOM)
 411    ):
 412        obj = pose_mapping[obj_type](identifier)
 413        t, q = obj.xpos, smb.r2q(np.reshape(obj.xmat, (3, 3)))
 414        return make_tf(pos=t, ori=q)
 415
 416    # Retrieve position and quaternion
 417    obj = pose_mapping[obj_type](identifier)
 418    t, q = obj.xpos, obj.xquat
 419    return make_tf(pos=t, ori=q)
 420
 421
 422def set_pose(
 423    model: mj.MjModel,
 424    data: mj.MjData,
 425    identifier: Union[int, str],
 426    obj_type: ObjType,
 427    T: sm.SE3,
 428) -> None:
 429    """
 430    Sets the pose (position and orientation) of an object in a MuJoCo model, if allowed.
 431
 432    Parameters
 433    ----------
 434    model : mj.MjModel
 435        The MuJoCo model containing the object.
 436    data : mj.MjData
 437        The simulation data where the pose is set.
 438    identifier : int or str
 439        The ID or name of the object.
 440    obj_type : ObjType
 441        The type of the object, e.g., body, joint.
 442    T : sm.SE3
 443        The desired pose as an SE3 transformation matrix.
 444    """
 445
 446    assert does_exist(model, identifier, obj_type)
 447
 448    def set_position_and_orientation(pos, quat):
 449        """Helper to set position and orientation."""
 450        pos[:] = T.t
 451        quat[:] = smb.r2q(T.R)
 452
 453    # Process based on object type
 454    if obj_type is ObjType.BODY:
 455        body_id = (
 456            identifier
 457            if isinstance(identifier, int)
 458            else mj.mj_name2id(model, ObjType.BODY.value, identifier)
 459        )
 460
 461        # Check if the body is a mocap body
 462        mocap_id = model.body_mocapid[body_id]
 463        if mocap_id != -1:
 464            set_position_and_orientation(
 465                data.mocap_pos[mocap_id], data.mocap_quat[mocap_id]
 466            )
 467            return
 468
 469        # Check if the body has a freejoint
 470        if JointType(model.jnt_type[model.body_jntadr[body_id]]) is JointType.FREE:
 471            jnt_id = model.body_jntadr[body_id]
 472            set_position_and_orientation(
 473                data.joint(jnt_id).qpos[:3], data.joint(jnt_id).qpos[3:]
 474            )
 475            return
 476
 477    elif obj_type is ObjType.JOINT:
 478        joint_id = (
 479            identifier
 480            if isinstance(identifier, int)
 481            else mj.mj_name2id(model, ObjType.JOINT.value, identifier)
 482        )
 483
 484        # Check if the joint is a freejoint
 485        if JointType(model.joint(joint_id).type[0]) is JointType.FREE:
 486            set_position_and_orientation(
 487                data.joint(joint_id).qpos[:3], data.joint(joint_id).qpos[3:]
 488            )
 489            return
 490
 491    # If no valid option found, raise an error
 492    raise ValueError(
 493        f"{obj_type.name} '{identifier}' cannot have its pose set. Only mocap bodies, bodies with freejoints, or freejoints are allowed."
 494    )
 495
 496
 497def get_joint_qpos_addr(model: mj.MjModel, joint_name: Union[int, str]) -> int:
 498    """
 499    Retrieves the address of the generalized position (qpos) for a specific joint in the MuJoCo model.
 500
 501    This function returns the index of the joint's generalized position in the `qpos` array
 502    of the MuJoCo model. This index can be used to access or modify the joint's position
 503    directly in the simulation data.
 504
 505    Parameters
 506    ----------
 507    model : mj.MjModel
 508        The MuJoCo model object from which to retrieve the joint's qpos address.
 509    joint_name : Union[int, str]
 510        The name or ID of the joint whose qpos address is being retrieved. Can be specified
 511        either as a string (name) or an integer (ID).
 512
 513    Returns
 514    ----------
 515    int
 516        The address (index) of the joint's generalized position in the `qpos` array.
 517
 518    Notes
 519    -----
 520    Ensure that the specified `joint_name` corresponds to a valid joint in the MuJoCo model.
 521    """
 522    joint_id = (
 523        joint_name
 524        if isinstance(joint_name, int)
 525        else name2id(model, joint_name, ObjType.JOINT)
 526    )
 527
 528    return model.jnt_qposadr[joint_id]
 529
 530
 531def set_joint_q(
 532    data: mj.MjData,
 533    model: mj.MjModel,
 534    joint_name: Union[int, str],
 535    q: Union[np.ndarray, float],
 536    unit: str = "rad",
 537) -> None:
 538    """
 539    Sets the position(s) (angle(s)) of a joint in the MuJoCo simulation.
 540
 541    This function updates the generalized position (`qpos`) of a specified joint in
 542    the MuJoCo simulation. The joint's position can be set in radians or degrees,
 543    depending on the `unit` parameter. If degrees are provided, they will be converted
 544    to radians before being applied. The positions are assigned to the joint's indices
 545    in the `qpos` array of the simulation data.
 546
 547    Parameters
 548    ----------
 549    data : mj.MjData
 550        The MuJoCo data object associated with the simulation.
 551    model : mj.MjModel
 552        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
 553    joint_name : Union[int, str]
 554        The name or ID of the joint whose position is being set.
 555    q : Union[np.ndarray, float]
 556        The position(s) (angle(s)) to be set for the joint. Can be a single value or an array
 557        of values, depending on the type of joint.
 558    unit : str, optional
 559        The unit of the position value, either "rad" (radians) or "deg" (degrees). Defaults to "rad".
 560
 561    Returns
 562    ----------
 563    None
 564
 565    Raises
 566    ------
 567    ValueError
 568        If the dimensions of `q` do not match the number of positions for the specified joint.
 569
 570    Notes
 571    -----
 572    - The `joint_name` can be specified as either a string (name) or an integer (ID).
 573    - If the unit is "deg", the function will convert the angles from degrees to radians before applying.
 574    - Ensure that the `q` values match the dimensions expected for the joint.
 575    """
 576    joint_name = (
 577        joint_name
 578        if isinstance(joint_name, int)
 579        else name2id(model, joint_name, ObjType.JOINT)
 580    )
 581
 582    # Convert q to radians if the unit is degrees
 583    if unit == "deg":
 584        q = np.deg2rad(q)
 585
 586    q_indxs = get_joint_qpos_indxs(data, model, joint_name)
 587
 588    # Ensure q is a numpy array
 589    if isinstance(q, (int, float)):
 590        q = np.array([q])
 591    if isinstance(q, list):
 592        q = np.array(q)
 593
 594    # Validate the dimensions of q
 595    if q.shape[0] != len(q_indxs):
 596        raise ValueError(
 597            f"Dimension mismatch: Expected dimension {len(q_indxs)}, "
 598            f"but got {q.shape[0]} for joint '{joint_name}'."
 599        )
 600
 601    data.qpos[q_indxs] = q
 602
 603
 604def set_joint_dq(
 605    data: mj.MjData,
 606    model: mj.MjModel,
 607    joint_name: Union[int, str],
 608    dq: Union[np.ndarray, float],
 609    unit: str = "rad",
 610) -> None:
 611    """
 612    Sets the velocity of a joint in the MuJoCo simulation.
 613
 614    This function updates the generalized velocity (`qvel`) of a specified joint
 615    in the MuJoCo simulation. The velocity can be specified in radians or degrees,
 616    and will be converted to radians if necessary. The velocities are assigned to the
 617    joint's degrees of freedom in the `qvel` array of the simulation data.
 618
 619    Parameters
 620    ----------
 621    data : mj.MjData
 622        The MuJoCo data object associated with the simulation.
 623    model : mj.MjModel
 624        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
 625    joint_name : Union[int, str]
 626        The name or ID of the joint whose velocity is being set.
 627    dq : Union[np.ndarray, float]
 628        The velocity value(s) to be set for the joint. This can be a single value or
 629        an array of values, depending on the type of joint.
 630    unit : str, optional
 631        The unit of the velocity value, either "rad" (radians) or "deg" (degrees). Defaults to "rad".
 632
 633    Returns
 634    ----------
 635    None
 636
 637    Raises
 638    ------
 639    ValueError
 640        If the dimensions of `dq` do not match the number of degrees of freedom for the specified joint.
 641
 642    Notes
 643    -----
 644    - The `joint_name` can be specified as either a string (name) or an integer (ID).
 645    - If the unit is "deg", the function will convert the velocities from degrees to radians before applying.
 646    - Ensure that the `dq` values match the dimensions expected for the joint.
 647    """
 648    joint_name = (
 649        joint_name
 650        if isinstance(joint_name, int)
 651        else name2id(model, joint_name, ObjType.JOINT)
 652    )
 653
 654    # Convert dq to radians if the unit is degrees
 655    if unit == "deg":
 656        dq = np.deg2rad(dq)
 657
 658    dq_indxs = get_joint_dof_indxs(model, joint_name)
 659
 660    # Ensure dq is a numpy array
 661    if isinstance(dq, (int, float)):
 662        dq = np.array([dq])
 663    if isinstance(dq, list):
 664        dq = np.array(dq)
 665
 666    # Validate the dimensions of dq
 667    if dq.shape[0] != len(dq_indxs):
 668        raise ValueError(
 669            f"Dimension mismatch: Expected dimension {len(dq_indxs)}, "
 670            f"but got {dq.shape[0]} for joint '{joint_name}'."
 671        )
 672    data.qvel[dq_indxs] = dq
 673
 674

 707

 712
 713    Notes
 714    -----
 715    - The `joint_name` can be specified as either a string (name) or an integer (ID).
 716    - If the unit is "deg", the function will convert the accelerations from degrees to radians before applying.
 717    - Ensure that the `ddq` values match the dimensions expected for the joint.
 718    """

 720        joint_name
 721        if isinstance(joint_name, int)
 722        else name2id(model, joint_name, ObjType.JOINT)
 723    )

 727        ddq = np.deg2rad(ddq)

 746def get_joint_q(
 747    data: mj.MjData, model: mj.MjModel, joint_name: Union[int, str]
 748) -> np.ndarray:
 749    """
 750    Retrieves the position (angle) of a joint in the MuJoCo simulation.
 751
 752    This function extracts the current position (or angle) of a specified joint
 753    from the MuJoCo simulation data. The joint position is obtained from the
 754    `qpos` array, which holds the generalized positions for all joints in the model.
 755
 756    Parameters
 757    ----------
 758    data : mj.MjData
 759        The MuJoCo data object associated with the simulation.
 760    model : mj.MjModel
 761        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
 762    joint_name : Union[int, str]
 763        The name or ID of the joint whose position is being retrieved.
 764
 765    Returns
 766    ----------
 767    np.ndarray
 768        An array containing the position (or angle) of the specified joint.
 769
 770    Notes
 771    -----
 772    - The `joint_name` can be specified as either a string (name) or an integer (ID).
 773    - The returned array includes the position values corresponding to the joint's degrees of freedom.
 774    - Ensure that the joint_name is valid and corresponds to an existing joint in the model.
 775    """
 776    joint_name = (
 777        joint_name
 778        if isinstance(joint_name, int)
 779        else name2id(model, joint_name, ObjType.JOINT)
 780    )
 781    q_indxs = get_joint_qpos_indxs(data, model, joint_name)
 782    return data.qpos[q_indxs]

 863def get_joint_qpos_indxs(
 864    data: mj.MjModel, model: mj.MjModel, joint_name: Union[int, str]
 865) -> np.ndarray:
 866    """
 867    Retrieves the indices in the `qpos` array corresponding to the specified joint in the MuJoCo model.
 868
 869    This function determines the indices in the `qpos` array where the position(s) of the specified joint are stored.
 870    The indices are computed based on the joint's position address and its dimension.
 871
 872    Parameters
 873    ----------
 874    data : mj.MjData
 875        The MuJoCo data object associated with the simulation.
 876    model : mj.MjModel
 877        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
 878    joint_name : Union[int, str]
 879        The name or ID of the joint whose `qpos` indices are to be retrieved.
 880
 881    Returns
 882    ----------
 883    np.ndarray
 884        An array of indices in the `qpos` array that correspond to the specified joint.
 885
 886    Notes
 887    -----
 888    - The `joint_name` can be provided as either a string (name) or an integer (ID).
 889    - Ensure that the `joint_name` is valid and corresponds to an existing joint in the model.
 890    """
 891    joint_name = (
 892        joint_name
 893        if isinstance(joint_name, int)
 894        else name2id(model, joint_name, ObjType.JOINT)
 895    )
 896    addr = get_joint_qpos_addr(model, joint_name)
 897    joint_dim = get_joint_dim(data, model, joint_name)
 898    return list(range(addr, addr + joint_dim))
 899
 900
 901def get_joint_dof_indxs(model: mj.MjModel, joint_name: Union[int, str]) -> np.ndarray:
 902    """
 903    Retrieves the degrees of freedom (DOF) indices for a specified joint in the MuJoCo model.
 904
 905    This function obtains the indices of the degrees of freedom for a given joint, which represent
 906    the joint's DOF in the MuJoCo model.
 907
 908    Parameters
 909    ----------
 910    model : mj.MjModel
 911        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
 912    joint_name : Union[int, str]
 913        The name or ID of the joint whose DOF indices are to be retrieved.
 914
 915    Returns
 916    ----------
 917    np.ndarray
 918        An array of indices corresponding to the degrees of freedom of the specified joint.
 919
 920    Notes
 921    -----
 922    - The `joint_name` can be provided as either a string (name) or an integer (ID).
 923    - Ensure that the `joint_name` is valid and corresponds to an existing joint in the model.
 924    """
 925    joint_name = (
 926        joint_name
 927        if isinstance(joint_name, int)
 928        else name2id(model, joint_name, ObjType.JOINT)
 929    )
 930    jdof = model.jnt_dofadr[joint_name]
 931    if not isinstance(jdof, np.ndarray):
 932        jdof = np.array([jdof])
 933    return jdof
 934
 935
 936def get_joint_dim(
 937    data: mj.MjData, model: mj.MjModel, joint_name: Union[str, int]
 938) -> int:
 939    """
 940    Retrieves the dimensionality (number of `qpos` elements) of the specified joint in the MuJoCo simulation.
 941
 942    This function determines the number of position elements (`qpos`) associated with a given joint,
 943    which reflects the joint's degrees of freedom or configuration.
 944
 945    Parameters
 946    ----------
 947    data : mj.MjData
 948        The MuJoCo data object associated with the simulation.
 949    model : mj.MjModel
 950        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
 951    joint_name : Union[str, int]
 952        The name or ID of the joint whose dimensionality is to be retrieved.
 953
 954    Returns
 955    ----------
 956    int
 957        The number of `qpos` elements for the specified joint, representing its dimensionality.
 958
 959    Notes
 960    -----
 961    - The `joint_name` can be specified as either a string (name) or an integer (ID).
 962    - Ensure that the `joint_name` is valid and corresponds to an existing joint in the model.
 963    """
 964    joint_name = (
 965        joint_name
 966        if isinstance(joint_name, int)
 967        else name2id(model, joint_name, ObjType.JOINT)
 968    )
 969    return len(data.joint(joint_name).qpos)

 971
 972def load_keyframe(
 973    model: mj.MjModel,
 974    data: mj.MjData,
 975    keyframe_name: str,
 976    file_path: str,
 977    return_xml: bool = False,
 978    log: bool = True,
 979    step: bool = True,
 980) -> Optional[str]:
 981    """
 982    Load a MuJoCo simulation state from a specified keyframe in an XML file or string.
 983
 984    Parameters
 985    ----------
 986    model : mj.MjModel
 987        The MuJoCo model object which defines the simulation.
 988    data : mj.MjData
 989        The MuJoCo data object to load the state into.
 990    keyframe_name : str
 991        The name of the keyframe state to load.
 992    return_xml : bool, optional
 993        If True, return the XML content as a string instead of loading it into the model. Defaults to False.
 994    file_path : str, optional
 995        Path to the XML file to load from. If None, defaults to "keyframes/<file_name>.xml".
 996    log : bool, optional
 997        Whether to log the loading action. Defaults to True.
 998    step : bool, optional
 999        Whether to step the simulation after loading the state. Defaults to True.
1000
1001    Returns
1002    -------
1003    Optional[str]
1004        If return_xml is True, returns the XML content as a string. Otherwise, returns None.
1005
1006    Raises
1007    ------
1008    ValueError
1009        If the specified state_name does not correspond to a valid keyframe.
1010    FileNotFoundError
1011        If the specified file_path does not exist.
1012    """
1013
1014    if return_xml:
1015        # Load XML content from file and return as string
1016        if os.path.exists(file_path):
1017            with open(file_path, "r") as file:
1018                xml_content = file.read()
1019            return xml_content
1020        else:
1021            print(f"File {file_path} not found.")
1022            return None
1023
1024    # Proceed with loading state from file
1025    if os.path.exists(file_path):
1026        tree = ET.parse(file_path)
1027        root = tree.getroot()
1028
1029        keyframe_element = root.find(".//keyframe")
1030        if keyframe_element is not None:
1031            try:
1032                state_id = model.keyframe(keyframe_name).id
1033            except Exception as e:
1034                raise ValueError(
1035                    f'"{keyframe_name}" does not seem to be available as a state, have you remembered to include the keyframes in your scene file? ERROR({e})'
1036                )
1037
1038            mj.mj_resetDataKeyframe(model, data, state_id)
1039            if log:
1040                print(f'Loaded : "{keyframe_name}" keyframe')
1041    else:
1042        print(f"File {file_path} not found.")
1043    if step:
1044        mj.mj_step(model, data)
1045
1046
1047def save_keyframe(
1048    model: mj.MjModel,
1049    data: mj.MjData,
1050    keyframe_name: str,
1051    save_path: str,
1052) -> None:
1053    """
1054    Save the current state of a MuJoCo simulation to an XML file as a keyframe.
1055
1056    Parameters
1057    ----------
1058    model : mj.MjModel
1059        The MuJoCo model object.
1060    data : mj.MjData
1061        The MuJoCo data object containing the current simulation state.
1062    keyframe_name : str
1063        The name to associate with the saved state.
1064    save_path : str
1065        The file path where the keyframes XML will be saved.
1066
1067    Notes
1068    -----
1069    - If the file doesn't exist, it is created with a root `<mujoco>` tag.
1070    - If a keyframe with the same name already exists, it will be overwritten.
1071    """
1072
1073    def format_array(array) -> str:
1074        """Format a NumPy array into a space-separated string."""
1075        return " ".join(map(str, np.asarray(array).flatten()))
1076
1077    # Check if the file exists and load or initialize the XML
1078    if os.path.exists(save_path) and os.path.getsize(save_path) > 0:
1079        tree = ET.parse(save_path)
1080        root = tree.getroot()
1081    else:
1082        root = ET.Element("mujoco")
1083        tree = ET.ElementTree(root)
1084
1085    # Find or create the <keyframe> element
1086    keyframe_element = root.find("keyframe")
1087    if keyframe_element is None:
1088        keyframe_element = ET.SubElement(root, "keyframe")
1089
1090    # Check for an existing keyframe with the same name
1091    existing_key = keyframe_element.find(f"./key[@name='{keyframe_name}']")
1092    if existing_key is not None:
1093        key_element = existing_key
1094        print(f"[save_keyframe]: overwriting {key_element}")
1095    else:
1096        key_element = ET.SubElement(keyframe_element, "key")
1097        key_element.set("name", keyframe_name)
1098
1099    # Update the keyframe attributes
1100    key_element.set("time", f"{data.time:.6f}")
1101    key_element.set("qpos", format_array(data.qpos))
1102    key_element.set("qvel", format_array(data.qvel))
1103    key_element.set("ctrl", format_array(data.ctrl))
1104    key_element.set("mpos", format_array(data.mocap_pos))
1105    key_element.set("mquat", format_array(data.mocap_quat))
1106
1107    # Save the updated XML to file
1108    os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(save_path), exist_ok=True)
1109    with open(save_path, "w", encoding="utf-8") as file:
1110        rough_string = ET.tostring(root, encoding="utf-8")
1111        reparsed = minidom.parseString(rough_string)
1112        file.write(reparsed.toprettyxml(indent="    "))
1113
1114    print(f"Saved keyframe '{keyframe_name}' to '{save_path}'.")
1115
1116
1117def apply_wrench(
1118    data: mj.MjData,
1119    model: mj.MjModel,
1120    body_name: str,
1121    wrench: Union[np.ndarray, List, Tuple],
1122) -> None:
1123    """
1124    Applies a wrench (force and torque) to a specific body in the MuJoCo simulation.
1125
1126    The wrench is a 6-dimensional vector that includes both force (fx, fy, fz) and torque (tx, ty, tz).
1127    This function allows you to apply the wrench to a body in the simulation using its name.
1128
1129    Parameters
1130    ----------
1131    data : mj.MjData
1132        The MuJoCo data object associated with the current simulation state.
1133    model : mj.MjModel
1134        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
1135    body_name : str
1136        The name of the body to which the wrench will be applied.
1137    wrench : Union[np.ndarray, List, Tuple]
1138        The wrench to be applied, provided as a 6-dimensional vector in any of the following formats:
1139        - numpy array
1140        - list
1141        - tuple
1142
1143    Returns
1144    -------
1145    None
1146
1147    Raises
1148    ------
1149    ValueError
1150        If the wrench is not a 6-dimensional vector or if the body name does not exist in the model.
1151    TypeError
1152        If the wrench is not a type that can be converted to a numpy array.
1153    """
1154
1155    # Ensure the wrench is a numpy array
1156    if isinstance(wrench, (list, tuple)):
1157        try:
1158            wrench = np.array(wrench)
1159        except Exception as e:
1160            raise TypeError(f"Unable to convert wrench to numpy array: {e}")
1161
1162    # Validate the wrench dimensions
1163    if wrench.shape != (6,):
1164        raise ValueError(
1165            "The wrench must be a 6-dimensional vector [fx, fy, fz, tx, ty, tz]."
1166        )
1167
1168    # Get the body ID
1169    try:
1170        target_id = name2id(model, body_name, ObjType.BODY)
1171    except Exception:
1172        raise ValueError(f"The body name '{body_name}' does not exist in the model.")
1173
1174    # Apply the wrench to the specified body
1175    data.xfrc_applied[target_id, :] = wrench
1176
1177
1178def get_geoms_in_contact(data: mj.MjData, model: mj.MjModel) -> List[Tuple[str, str]]:
1179    """
1180    Retrieve a list of geometry pairs currently in contact in the MuJoCo simulation.
1181
1182    This function iterates through all contacts in the MuJoCo simulation data and
1183    collects the names of geometries that are in contact. It returns a list of tuples,
1184    where each tuple contains the names of two geometries that are in contact.
1185
1186    Args
1187    ----------
1188    data : mj.MjData
1189        The MuJoCo data object containing the current state of the simulation.
1190    model : mj.MjModel
1191        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
1192
1193    Returns
1194    ----------
1195    List[Tuple[str, str]]:
1196        A list of tuples, where each tuple contains the names of two geometries that are in contact.
1197
1198    Notes
1199    ----------
1200    Ensure that the MuJoCo model and data are correctly initialized before calling this function.
1201    The function assumes that all contact pairs are relevant and does not filter them.
1202    """
1203    contact_states = []
1204
1205    for i in range(data.ncon):
1206        contact = data.contact[i]
1207        geom1_name = id2name(model, contact.geom1, ObjType.GEOM)
1208        geom2_name = id2name(model, contact.geom2, ObjType.GEOM)
1209        contact_states.append((geom1_name, geom2_name))
1210
1211    return contact_states
1212
1213
1214def get_bodies_in_contact(data: mj.MjData, model: mj.MjModel) -> List[Tuple[str, str]]:
1215    geom_ids_in_contact = []
1216
1217    for i in range(data.ncon):
1218        contact = data.contact[i]
1219        geom_ids_in_contact.append((contact.geom1, contact.geom2))
1220
1221    gids = [gid for gid in geom_ids_in_contact]
1222    for gid in gids:
1223        print(
1224            "\t",
1225            id2name(model, gid[0], ObjType.GEOM),
1226            id2name(model, gid[1], ObjType.GEOM),
1227        )
1228    bids = [model.geom_bodyid[gid[0]] for gid in gids]
1229
1230    print(f"{gids=}")
1231    print(f"{bids=}")
1232
1233    body_names = [
1234        (
1235            id2name(model, int(model.geom_bodyid[gid[0]]), ObjType.BODY),
1236            id2name(model, int(model.geom_bodyid[gid[1]]), ObjType.BODY),
1237        )
1238        for gid in geom_ids_in_contact
1239    ]
1240
1241    return body_names
1242
1243
1244def get_joint_pos(data: mj.MjData, model: mj.MjModel, joint_name: str) -> np.ndarray:
1245    """
1246    Retrieve the position of a specified joint in the MuJoCo simulation.
1247
1248    This function returns the anchor position of the specified joint.
1249
1250    Args:
1251    ----------
1252    data : mj.MjData
1253        The MuJoCo data object containing simulation data.
1254    model : mj.MjModel
1255        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
1256    joint_name : str
1257        The name of the joint whose position is to be retrieved.
1258
1259    Returns:
1260    ----------
1261    np.ndarray:
1262        The anchor position of the specified joint as a NumPy array.
1263
1264    Notes:
1265    ----------
1266    Ensure that the specified joint name exists in the MuJoCo model.
1267    Raises a ValueError if the joint name is not found.
1268    """
1269    try:
1270        joint_id = name2id(model, joint_name, ObjType.JOINT)
1271        return data.joint(joint_id).xanchor
1272    except Exception as e:
1273        raise ValueError(f"Joint '{joint_name}' not found in the model.") from e
1274
1275
1276def get_geom_distance(
1277    data: mj.MjData,
1278    model: mj.MjModel,
1279    geom1: Union[int, str],
1280    geom2: Union[int, str],
1281    distmax: float = 10.0,
1282) -> Tuple[float, np.ndarray]:
1283    """
1284    Calculate the smallest signed distance between two geometries (geoms) and the segment from one geom to the other.
1285
1286    This function computes the distance between two specified geoms and provides the segment vector between them.
1287    The distance is computed within a specified maximum distance, `distmax`. If the distance is greater than
1288    `distmax`, the function will return `distmax`.
1289
1290    Args:
1291    ----------
1292    data : mj.MjData
1293        The MuJoCo data object containing the current state of the simulation.
1294    model : mj.MjModel
1295        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
1296    geom1 : Union[int, str]
1297        The ID or name of the first geometry.
1298    geom2 : Union[int, str]
1299        The ID or name of the second geometry.
1300    distmax : float, optional
1301        The maximum distance for the distance calculation. Defaults to 10.0.
1302
1303    Returns:
1304    ----------
1305    Tuple[float, np.ndarray]
1306        A tuple where the first element is the smallest signed distance between the two geoms, and the second
1307        element is the segment vector from `geom1` to `geom2`.
1308
1309    Raises:
1310    ----------
1311    ValueError
1312        If `geom1` or `geom2` is not a valid geometry ID or name, or if `distmax` is not a positive number.
1313
1314    Notes:
1315    ----------
1316    - Ensure that both `geom1` and `geom2` are valid geometry IDs or names within the MuJoCo model.
1317    - The distance calculation is sensitive to the model and simulation state. Ensure that the simulation is updated
1318      if necessary before calling this function.
1319    """
1320
1321    if not isinstance(distmax, (int, float)) or distmax <= 0:
1322        raise ValueError(
1323            f"Invalid `distmax` value: {distmax}. It must be a positive number."
1324        )
1325
1326    # Convert geom names to IDs if necessary
1327    geom1 = name2id(model, geom1, ObjType.GEOM) if isinstance(geom1, str) else geom1
1328    geom2 = name2id(model, geom2, ObjType.GEOM) if isinstance(geom2, str) else geom2
1329
1330    # Initialize the segment vector
1331    from_to = np.zeros(6)
1332
1333    # Calculate the distance and segment
1334    distance = mj.mj_geomDistance(model, data, geom1, geom2, distmax, from_to)
1335
1336    _from = from_to[:3]
1337    _to = from_to[3:]
1338
1339    return distance, _from, _to
1340
1341
1342@dataclass
1343class ContactState:
1344    """
1345    A class to represent the state of a contact in a MuJoCo simulation.
1346
1347    Attributes
1348    ----------
1349    H : np.ndarray
1350        A 36-element cone Hessian, set by `mj_updateConstraint`.
1351    dim : int
1352        The contact space dimensionality: 1, 3, 4, or 6.
1353    dist : float
1354        The distance between the nearest points; negative values indicate penetration.
1355    efc_address : int
1356        The address in the constraint force Jacobian.
1357    elem : np.ndarray
1358        A 2-element array of integers representing element IDs; -1 for geom or flex vertex.
1359    exclude : int
1360        Exclusion flag for the contact: 0 (include), 1 (in gap), 2 (fused), 3 (no dofs).
1361    flex : np.ndarray
1362        A 2-element array of integers representing flex IDs; -1 for geom.
1363    frame : np.ndarray
1364        A 9-element array representing the contact frame. The normal is in [0-2] and points from geom[0] to geom[1].
1365    friction : np.ndarray
1366        A 5-element array representing friction parameters: tangent1, 2, spin, roll1, roll2.
1367    geom : np.ndarray
1368        A 2-element array of integers representing the IDs of the geometries in contact; -1 for flex.
1369    geom1 : int
1370        The first geometry index.
1371    geom2 : int
1372        The second geometry index.
1373    geom_names : np.ndarray
1374        A 2-element array of strings representing the names of the geometries in contact.
1375    geom1_name : str
1376        The name of the first geometry.
1377    geom2_name : str
1378        The name of the second geometry.
1379    includemargin : float
1380        The inclusion margin for the contact; includes if dist < includemargin = margin - gap.
1381    mu : float
1382        The coefficient of friction.
1383    pos : np.ndarray
1384        A 3-element array representing the position of the contact point, typically the midpoint between geometries.
1385    solimp : np.ndarray
1386        A 5-element array for solver impedance parameters.
1387    solref : np.ndarray
1388        A 2-element array for solver reference parameters for the normal direction.
1389    solreffriction : np.ndarray
1390        A 2-element array for solver reference parameters related to friction directions.
1391    vert : np.ndarray
1392        A 2-element array of integers representing vertex IDs; -1 for geom or flex element.
1393    index : int
1394        The index of the contact in the simulation.
1395    model : mj.MjModel
1396        The MuJoCo model object.
1397    data : mj.MjData
1398        The MuJoCo data object.
1399    c_wrench : np.ndarray
1400        A 6-element array representing the wrench (force and torque) at the contact in the contact frame.
1401    w_wrench : np.ndarray
1402        A 6-element array representing the wrench (force and torque) at the contact in the world frame.
1403
1404    Methods
1405    -------
1406    _compute_wrench():
1407        Computes the wrench for the contact based on the model, data, and contact index.
1408
1409    _transform_wrench_to_global(wrench: np.ndarray):
1410        Transforms the contact wrench from the contact frame to the world frame.
1411
1412    from_mjcontact(cls, mjcontact, model, data, index=-1):
1413        Creates a ContactState instance from a given MjContact object.
1414    """
1415
1416    data: mj.MjData = None
1417    model: mj.MjModel = None
1418    H: np.ndarray = field(default_factory=lambda: np.zeros(36))
1419    dim: int = 0
1420    dist: float = 0.0
1421    efc_address: int = 0
1422    elem: np.ndarray = field(default_factory=lambda: np.array([-1, -1], dtype=int))
1423    exclude: int = 0
1424    flex: np.ndarray = field(default_factory=lambda: np.array([-1, -1], dtype=int))
1425    frame: np.ndarray = field(default_factory=lambda: np.zeros(9))
1426    friction: np.ndarray = field(default_factory=lambda: np.zeros(5))
1427    geom: np.ndarray = field(default_factory=lambda: np.array([-1, -1], dtype=int))
1428    geom1: int = 0
1429    geom2: int = 0
1430    geom_names: np.ndarray = field(
1431        default_factory=lambda: np.array([-1, -1], dtype=int)
1432    )
1433    geom1_name: str = None
1434    geom2_name: str = None
1435    includemargin: float = 0.0
1436    mu: float = 0.0
1437    pos: np.ndarray = field(default_factory=lambda: np.zeros(3))
1438    solimp: np.ndarray = field(default_factory=lambda: np.zeros(5))
1439    solref: np.ndarray = field(default_factory=lambda: np.zeros(2))
1440    solreffriction: np.ndarray = field(default_factory=lambda: np.zeros(2))
1441    vert: np.ndarray = field(default_factory=lambda: np.array([-1, -1], dtype=int))
1442    index: int = -1
1443    c_wrench: np.ndarray = field(init=False)
1444    w_wrench: np.ndarray = field(init=False)
1445
1446    def __repr__(self):
1447        s = f"{type(self).__name__}(\n\t{self.pos=},\n\t{self.c_wrench=},\n\t{self.w_wrench=},\n\t{self.geom=},\n\t{self.geom_names=}\n)"
1448        return s
1449
1450    def __post_init__(self):
1451        self.c_wrench = self._compute_wrench()
1452        self.w_wrench = self._transform_wrench_to_global(self.c_wrench)
1453        self.geom1_name = id2name(self.model, self.geom1, ObjType.GEOM)
1454        self.geom2_name = id2name(self.model, self.geom2, ObjType.GEOM)
1455        self.geom_names = np.array([self.geom1_name, self.geom2_name])
1456
1457    def _compute_wrench(self):
1458        c_array = np.zeros(6, dtype=np.float64)
1459        if self.index >= 0 and self.model is not None and self.data is not None:
1460            mj.mj_contactForce(self.model, self.data, self.index, c_array)
1461        return c_array
1462
1463    def _transform_wrench_to_global(self, wrench: np.ndarray):
1464        # Contact frame as 3x3 matrix
1465        contact_frame = self.frame.reshape(3, 3)
1466        w_wrench = np.ones_like(wrench)
1467        # Transform force (first 3 elements of wrench)
1468        w_wrench[:3] = contact_frame.T @ wrench[:3]
1469        w_wrench[3:] = contact_frame.T @ wrench[3:]
1470        return w_wrench
1471
1472    @classmethod
1473    def from_mjcontact(
1474        cls, mjcontact, data: mj.MjData, model: mj.MjModel, index: int = -1
1475    ):
1476        return cls(
1477            H=mjcontact.H,
1478            dim=mjcontact.dim,
1479            dist=mjcontact.dist,
1480            efc_address=mjcontact.efc_address,
1481            elem=mjcontact.elem,
1482            exclude=mjcontact.exclude,
1483            flex=mjcontact.flex,
1484            frame=mjcontact.frame,
1485            friction=mjcontact.friction,
1486            geom=mjcontact.geom,
1487            geom1=mjcontact.geom1,
1488            geom2=mjcontact.geom2,
1489            includemargin=mjcontact.includemargin,
1490            mu=mjcontact.mu,
1491            pos=mjcontact.pos,
1492            solimp=mjcontact.solimp,
1493            solref=mjcontact.solref,
1494            solreffriction=mjcontact.solreffriction,
1495            vert=mjcontact.vert,
1496            index=index,
1497            data=data,
1498            model=model,
1499        )
1500

1502class RobotInfo:
1503    def __init__(self, model: mj.MjModel, name: str):
1504        self.name = name
1505        self.m = model
1506
1507        # Use list comprehensions to filter bodies and geometries by name
1508        self._body_ids = [
1509            model.body(i).id
1510            for i in range(model.nbody)
1511            if (self.name in model.body(i).name)
1512        ]
1513        self._body_names = [id2name(model, id, ObjType.BODY) for id in self._body_ids]
1514
1515        self._geom_ids = [
1516            model.geom(i).id
1517            for i in range(model.ngeom)
1518            if (self.name in model.geom(i).name)
1519        ]
1520        self._geom_names = [id2name(model, id, ObjType.GEOM) for id in self._geom_ids]
1521
1522        # Convert remaining function calls into list comprehensions
1523        self._joint_indxs = [
1524            model.joint(i).qposadr
1525            for i in range(model.njnt)
1526            if (self.name in model.joint(i).name)
1527        ]
1528        self._dof_indxs = [
1529            model.joint(i).dofadr
1530            for i in range(model.njnt)
1531            if (self.name in model.joint(i).name)
1532        ]
1533        self._joint_ids = [
1534            model.joint(i).id
1535            for i in range(model.njnt)
1536            if (self.name in model.joint(i).name)
1537        ]
1538        self._joint_names = [
1539            id2name(model, id, ObjType.JOINT) for id in self._joint_ids
1540        ]
1541
1542        self._actuator_ids = [
1543            model.actuator(i).id
1544            for i in range(model.nu)
1545            if (self.name in model.actuator(i).name)
1546        ]
1547        self._actuator_names = [
1548            id2name(model, id, ObjType.ACTUATOR) for id in self._actuator_ids
1549        ]
1550
1551        self._site_ids = [
1552            model.site(i).id
1553            for i in range(model.nsite)
1554            if (self.name in model.site(i).name)
1555        ]
1556        self._site_names = [id2name(model, id, ObjType.SITE) for id in self._site_ids]
1557
1558        # Sensor information
1559        self._sensor_ids = [
1560            model.sensor(i).id
1561            for i in range(model.nsensor)
1562            if (self.name in model.sensor(i).name)
1563        ]
1564        self._sensor_names = [
1565            id2name(model, id, ObjType.SENSOR) for id in self._sensor_ids
1566        ]
1567
1568        # Camera information
1569        self._camera_ids = [
1570            model.camera(i).id
1571            for i in range(model.ncam)
1572            if (self.name in model.camera(i).name)
1573        ]
1574        self._camera_names = [
1575            id2name(model, id, ObjType.CAMERA) for id in self._camera_ids
1576        ]
1577
1578    def print(self) -> None:
1579        """
1580        Print the robot's information in a formatted and indented list.
1581
1582        This method outputs the robot's detailed information, including base body name,
1583        number of bodies, actuators, joints, geometries, joint limits, and actuator limits.
1584        Each component's name and ID are listed with proper indentation to provide a clear,
1585        organized view of the robot's structure and components.
1586        """
1587        print(f"Robot Name: {self.name}")
1588        print(f"Number of Bodies: {len(self.body_names)}")
1589        print(f"Number of Actuators: {self.n_actuators}")
1590        print(f"Number of Joints: {self.n_joints}")
1591        print(f"Number of Geometries: {len(self.geom_names)}\n")
1592
1593        print("Bodies:")
1594        for i, body_name in enumerate(self.body_names):
1595            print(f"  {i + 1}. {body_name} (ID: {self.body_ids[i]})")
1596
1597        print("\nActuators:")
1598        for i, actuator_name in enumerate(self.actuator_names):
1599            print(f"  {i + 1}. {actuator_name} (ID: {self.actuator_ids[i]})")
1600
1601        print("\nJoints:")
1602        for i, joint_name in enumerate(self.joint_names):
1603            print(f"  {i + 1}. {joint_name} (ID: {self.joint_ids[i]})")
1604
1605        print("\nJoint Limits (min, max):")
1606        for i, (joint_name, limits) in enumerate(
1607            zip(self.joint_names, self.joint_limits.T)
1608        ):
1609            print(f"  {i + 1}. {joint_name}: {limits[0]:.2f}, {limits[1]:.2f}")
1610
1611        print("\nActuator Limits (min, max):")
1612        for i, (actuator_name, limits) in enumerate(
1613            zip(self.actuator_names, self.actuator_limits.T)
1614        ):
1615            print(f"  {i + 1}. {actuator_name}: {limits[0]:.2f}, {limits[1]:.2f}")
1616
1617        print("\nGeometries:")
1618        for i, geom_name in enumerate(self.geom_names):
1619            print(f"  {i + 1}. {geom_name} (ID: {self.geom_ids[i]})")
1620
1621        print("\nSites:")
1622        for i, site_name in enumerate(self.site_names):
1623            print(f"  {i + 1}. {site_name} (ID: {self.site_ids[i]})")
1624
1625        print("\nSensors:")
1626        for i, sensor_name in enumerate(self.sensor_names):
1627            print(f"  {i + 1}. {sensor_name} (ID: {self.sensor_ids[i]})")
1628
1629        print("\nCameras:")
1630        for i, camera_name in enumerate(self.camera_names):
1631            print(f"  {i + 1}. {camera_name} (ID: {self.camera_ids[i]})")

1797
1798def get_contact_states(
1799    data: mj.MjData,
1800    model: mj.MjModel,
1801    geom_names1: Union[int, str, List[Union[int, str]], np.ndarray] = None,
1802    geom_names2: Union[int, str, List[Union[int, str]], np.ndarray] = None,
1803) -> Tuple[bool, List[ContactState]]:
1804    """
1805    Retrieves the contact states for specified geometries in the MuJoCo simulation.
1806
1807    Parameters
1808    ----------
1809    data : mj.MjData
1810        The MuJoCo data object containing the current state of the simulation, including contact information.
1811    model : mj.MjModel
1812        The MuJoCo model object, which defines the structure of the simulation including geometries.
1813    geom_names1 : Union[int, str, List[int], List[str], np.ndarray], optional
1814        The name or ID of the first geometry (or a list/array of them) to check for contact.
1815        If provided, the function filters the contact states to include only those involving this geometry.
1816        Default is None.
1817    geom_names2 : Union[int, str, List[int], List[str], np.ndarray], optional
1818        The name or ID of the second geometry (or a list/array of them) to check for contact.
1819        If provided, the function filters the contact states to include only those involving both specified geometries.
1820        Default is None.
1821
1822    Returns
1823    -------
1824    Tuple[bool, List[ContactState]]
1825        - A boolean indicating whether any contact was found (`True` if there are contact states, `False` otherwise).
1826        - A list of ContactState objects representing the states of the contacts in the simulation.
1827
1828    Notes
1829    -----
1830    - If both `geom_names1` and `geom_names2` are provided, the function returns only the contacts involving both geometries.
1831    - If only one geometry (either name or ID or list of them) is provided, the function returns all contacts involving that geometry.
1832    - If no geometry names or IDs are provided, the function returns all contact states in the simulation.
1833
1834    Examples
1835    --------
1836    # Example 1: Get all contact states in the simulation
1837    in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model)
1838
1839    # Example 2: Get contact states involving a specific geometry by name
1840    in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model, geom_names1='geom1')
1841
1842    # Example 3: Get contact states involving two specific geometries by IDs
1843    in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model, geom_names1=3, geom_names2=5)
1844
1845    # Example 4: Get contact states involving any of multiple geometries
1846    in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model, geom_names1=['geom1', 'geom2'])
1847
1848    # Example 5: Get contact states involving pairs of geometries from two lists
1849    in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model, geom_names1=[3, 5], geom_names2=['geom6', 'geom7'])
1850    """
1851
1852    def get_geom_ids(geom_names):
1853        """Helper function to convert names/IDs to a list of geometry IDs."""
1854        if geom_names is None:
1855            return None
1856        if isinstance(geom_names, (int, str)):
1857            geom_names = [geom_names]  # Convert single value to list
1858        return [
1859            geom if isinstance(geom, int) else name2id(model, geom, ObjType.GEOM)
1860            for geom in geom_names
1861        ]
1862
1863    geom_ids1 = get_geom_ids(geom_names1)
1864    geom_ids2 = get_geom_ids(geom_names2)
1865
1866    # Get all contact states
1867    contact_states: List[ContactState] = []
1868    for i in range(data.ncon):
1869        contact = data.contact[i]
1870        cs = ContactState.from_mjcontact(contact, data, model, i)
1871        contact_states.append(cs)
1872
1873    # Filter contacts based on the provided geometry names or IDs
1874    if geom_ids1 is not None:
1875        contact_states = [
1876            cs
1877            for cs in contact_states
1878            if cs.geom1 in geom_ids1 or cs.geom2 in geom_ids1
1879        ]
1880
1881    if geom_ids2 is not None:
1882        contact_states = [
1883            cs
1884            for cs in contact_states
1885            if (cs.geom1 in geom_ids2 or cs.geom2 in geom_ids2)
1886            and (geom_ids1 is None or cs.geom1 in geom_ids1 or cs.geom2 in geom_ids1)
1887        ]
1888
1889    in_contact = len(contact_states) != 0
1890
1891    return in_contact, contact_states
class JointType(enum.Enum): 
17class JointType(Enum):
18    """
19    Enumeration of joint types used in MuJoCo simulations.
20
21    This class defines the types of joints that can be used in a MuJoCo simulation,
22    including free, ball, slide, and hinge joints. These joint types are associated
23    with integer values that are used within the MuJoCo framework to specify the type
24    of joint for different elements of the model.
25
26    Attributes
27    ----------
28    FREE : int
29        A joint that allows for unrestricted movement in all translational and rotational
30        degrees of freedom. Represented by the integer value 0.
31    BALL : int
32        A ball-and-socket joint that allows rotation in all directions, but no translational
33        movement. Represented by the integer value 1.
34    SLIDE : int
35        A prismatic joint that allows translational movement along a single axis, with no
36        rotational freedom. Represented by the integer value 2.
37    HINGE : int
38        A rotational joint that allows rotation around a single axis, similar to a door hinge.
39        Represented by the integer value 3.
40    """
41
42    FREE = int(mj.mjtJoint.mjJNT_FREE)
43    BALL = int(mj.mjtJoint.mjJNT_BALL)
44    SLIDE = int(mj.mjtJoint.mjJNT_SLIDE)
45    HINGE = int(mj.mjtJoint.mjJNT_HINGE)

SLIDE : int A prismatic joint that allows translational movement along a single axis, with no rotational freedom. Represented by the integer value 2. HINGE : int A rotational joint that allows rotation around a single axis, similar to a door hinge. Represented by the integer value 3.

 48class ObjType(Enum):
 49    """
 50    Enumeration of object types used in MuJoCo simulations.
 51
 52    This class defines various object types that can be used in a MuJoCo simulation,
 53    including bodies, joints, geoms, sites, actuators, and sensors. These object types
 54    are associated with integer values that are used within the MuJoCo framework to
 55    specify the type of object for different elements of the model.
 56
 57    Attributes
 58    ----------
 59    UNKNOWN : int
 60        Represents an unknown object type. Used when the object type is not recognized.
 61        Represented by the integer value 0.
 62    BODY : int
 63        Represents a body in the simulation. Bodies are rigid objects that can be connected
 64        by joints or other constraints. Represented by the integer value 1.
 65    XBODY : int
 66        Represents a body but used to access the regular frame instead of the i-frame.
 67        Represented by the integer value 2.
 68    JOINT : int
 69        Represents a joint that connects two bodies and allows for relative movement.
 70        Represented by the integer value 3.
 71    DOF : int
 72        Represents a degree of freedom (DOF) of a joint, typically used to describe the
 73        axes along which a joint can move or rotate. Represented by the integer value 4.
 74    GEOM : int
 75        Represents a geometric shape associated with a body, used for collision detection
 76        and visual rendering. Represented by the integer value 5.
 77    SITE : int
 78        Represents a site, which is a fixed point or frame on a body used for specifying
 79        positions or attaching sensors. Represented by the integer value 6.
 80    CAMERA : int
 81        Represents a camera, which can be used to render views of the simulation environment.
 82        Represented by the integer value 7.
 83    LIGHT : int
 84        Represents a light source in the simulation environment. Represented by the integer
 85        value 8.
 86    FLEX : int
 87        Represents a flex object, typically used in simulations of flexible materials.
 88        Represented by the integer value 9.
 89    MESH : int
 90        Represents a mesh object, typically a more complex geometric shape defined by vertices
 91        and faces. Represented by the integer value 10.
 92    SKIN : int
 93        Represents a skin, usually used for rendering soft or flexible outer surfaces on bodies.
 94        Represented by the integer value 11.
 95    HFIELD : int
 96        Represents a heightfield, typically used to model uneven terrain or surfaces in the
 97        simulation. Represented by the integer value 12.
 98    TEXTURE : int
 99        Represents a texture, which can be applied to geometric shapes for visual realism.
100        Represented by the integer value 13.
101    MATERIAL : int
102        Represents a material for rendering, which defines visual properties like color and
103        reflectiveness. Represented by the integer value 14.
104    PAIR : int
105        Represents a geom pair to include in the simulation for collision detection.
106        Represented by the integer value 15.
107    EXCLUDE : int
108        Represents a body pair to exclude from collision detection. Represented by the integer
109        value 16.
110    EQUALITY : int
111        Represents an equality constraint, used to enforce specific relationships between
112        different elements in the simulation. Represented by the integer value 17.
113    TENDON : int
114        Represents a tendon, typically used to model soft structures or actuators in biological
115        systems. Represented by the integer value 18.
116    ACTUATOR : int
117        Represents an actuator, which generates forces or torques to move bodies in the simulation.
118        Represented by the integer value 19.
119    SENSOR : int
120        Represents a sensor, which is used to measure various aspects of the simulation such as
121        positions, velocities, or forces. Represented by the integer value 20.
122    NUMERIC : int
123        Represents a numeric element, often used for user-defined values or parameters.
124        Represented by the integer value 21.
125    TEXT : int
126        Represents a text element, used to store or display text in the simulation.
127        Represented by the integer value 22.
128    TUPLE : int
129        Represents a tuple, often used to group multiple elements together.
130        Represented by the integer value 23.
131    KEY : int
132        Represents a keyframe, used to save or restore the state of the simulation at specific
133        points in time. Represented by the integer value 24.

135        Represents a plugin instance, which can be used to extend the functionality of the
136        simulation with user-defined code. Represented by the integer value 25.
137    """

151    MESH = int(mj.mjtObj.mjOBJ_MESH)  # mesh

def get_number_of(model: mujoco._structs.MjModel, obj_type: ObjType) -> int: 
171def get_number_of(model: mj.MjModel, obj_type: ObjType) -> int:
172    """
173    Retrieves the count of objects of a specified type in a MuJoCo model.
174
175    Parameters
176    ----------
177    model : mj.MjModel
178        The MuJoCo model from which to count objects.
179    obj_type : ObjType
180        The type of objects to count, e.g., actuators, bodies, joints.
181
182    Returns
183    -------
184    int
185        The number of objects of the specified type in the model.
186
187    Raises
188    ------
189    ValueError
190        If the specified object type is not recognized.
191    """
192    type_to_attribute = {
193        ObjType.ACTUATOR: model.nu,
194        ObjType.BODY: model.nbody,
195        ObjType.JOINT: model.njnt,
196        ObjType.DOF: model.nv,
197        ObjType.GEOM: model.ngeom,
198        ObjType.SITE: model.nsite,
199        ObjType.CAMERA: model.ncam,
200        ObjType.LIGHT: model.nlight,
201        ObjType.MESH: model.nmesh,
202        ObjType.SKIN: model.nskin,
203        ObjType.HFIELD: model.nhfield,
204        ObjType.TEXTURE: model.ntex,
205        ObjType.MATERIAL: model.nmat,
206        ObjType.PAIR: model.npair,
207        ObjType.EXCLUDE: model.nexclude,
208        ObjType.EQUALITY: model.neq,
209        ObjType.TENDON: model.ntendon,
210        ObjType.SENSOR: model.nsensordata,
211        ObjType.NUMERIC: model.nnumeric,
212        ObjType.TEXT: model.ntext,
213        ObjType.TUPLE: model.ntuple,
214        ObjType.KEY: model.nkey,
215        ObjType.PLUGIN: model.nplugin,
216        ObjType.FRAME: 0,  # No direct model attribute
217    }
218
219    if obj_type not in type_to_attribute:
220        raise ValueError(f"Object type {obj_type} not recognized.")
221
222    return type_to_attribute[obj_type]
