def does_exist( model: mujoco._structs.MjModel, identifier: Union[int, str], obj_type: ObjType) -> bool: 
312def does_exist(
313    model: mj.MjModel, identifier: Union[int, str], obj_type: ObjType
314) -> bool:
315    """
316    Checks if an object with a given name or ID exists in a MuJoCo model.
317
318    Parameters
319    ----------
320    model : mj.MjModel
321        The MuJoCo model to check within.
322    identifier : int or str
323        The ID or name of the object.
324    obj_type : ObjType
325        The type of the object, e.g., geom, sensor.
326
327    Returns
328    -------
329    bool
330        True if the object exists, False otherwise.
331
332    Raises
333    ------
334    ValueError
335        If the object type is unrecognized or if the specified identifier type is invalid.
336    """
337    if isinstance(identifier, str):
338        exists = (
339            True if mj.mj_name2id(model, obj_type.value, identifier) != -1 else False
340        )
341        if not exists:
342            raise ValueError(
343                f"{obj_type.name} name '{identifier}' not found in the model. The model contain the {obj_type.name}s {get_names(model, obj_type)}"
344            )
345    elif isinstance(identifier, int):
346        exists = (
347            True
348            if mj.mj_id2name(model, obj_type.value, identifier) is not None
349            else False
350        )
351        if not exists:
352            raise ValueError(
353                f"{obj_type.name} id '{identifier}' not found in the model. The model contain the {obj_type.name}s {get_ids(model, obj_type)}"
354            )
355    else:
356        raise ValueError(
357            f"Invalid type input id with value '{identifier}' and type {type(identifier)} use either string or int."
358        )
359    return exists

Checks if an object with a given name or ID exists in a MuJoCo model.

Parameters

model : mj.MjModel The MuJoCo model to check within. identifier : int or str The ID or name of the object. obj_type : ObjType The type of the object, e.g., geom, sensor.

Returns

bool True if the object exists, False otherwise.

Raises

ValueError If the object type is unrecognized or if the specified identifier type is invalid.

def get_pose( model: mujoco._structs.MjModel, data: mujoco._structs.MjData, identifier: Union[int, str], obj_type: ObjType) -> spatialmath.pose3d.SE3: 
362def get_pose(
363    model: mj.MjModel, data: mj.MjData, identifier: Union[int, str], obj_type: ObjType
364) -> sm.SE3:
365    """
366    Retrieves the pose (position and orientation) of an object in a MuJoCo model.
367
368    Parameters
369    ----------
370    model : mj.MjModel
371        The MuJoCo model containing the object.
372    data : mj.MjData
373        The simulation data containing the pose information.
374    identifier : int or str
375        The ID or name of the object.
376    obj_type : ObjType
377        The type of the object, e.g., body, site, camera.
378
379    Returns
380    -------
381    sm.SE3
382        The pose of the object as an SE3 transformation matrix.
383
384    Raises
385    ------
386    ValueError
387        If the object type does not support pose retrieval.
388    """
389
390    if not does_exist(model, identifier, obj_type):
391        return sm.SE3()
392
393    # Define a mapping for types that can provide poses
394    pose_mapping = {
395        ObjType.ACTUATOR: data.actuator,
396        ObjType.BODY: data.body,
397        ObjType.JOINT: data.joint,
398        ObjType.GEOM: data.geom,
399        ObjType.SITE: data.site,
400        ObjType.CAMERA: data.cam,
401        ObjType.LIGHT: data.light,
402    }
403
404    # Check if type has a pose; raise an error if it does not
405    if obj_type not in pose_mapping:
406        raise ValueError(f"obj_type {obj_type.name} cannot provide a pose...")
407
408    if (
409        (obj_type is ObjType.CAMERA)
410        or (obj_type is ObjType.SITE)
411        or (obj_type is ObjType.GEOM)
412    ):
413        obj = pose_mapping[obj_type](identifier)
414        t, q = obj.xpos, smb.r2q(np.reshape(obj.xmat, (3, 3)))
415        return make_tf(pos=t, ori=q)
416
417    # Retrieve position and quaternion
418    obj = pose_mapping[obj_type](identifier)
419    t, q = obj.xpos, obj.xquat
420    return make_tf(pos=t, ori=q)

Retrieves the pose (position and orientation) of an object in a MuJoCo model.

Parameters

model : mj.MjModel The MuJoCo model containing the object. data : mj.MjData The simulation data containing the pose information. identifier : int or str The ID or name of the object. obj_type : ObjType The type of the object, e.g., body, site, camera.

Returns

sm.SE3 The pose of the object as an SE3 transformation matrix.

Raises

ValueError If the object type does not support pose retrieval.

def set_pose( model: mujoco._structs.MjModel, data: mujoco._structs.MjData, identifier: Union[int, str], obj_type: ObjType, T: spatialmath.pose3d.SE3) -> None: 
423def set_pose(
424    model: mj.MjModel,
425    data: mj.MjData,
426    identifier: Union[int, str],
427    obj_type: ObjType,
428    T: sm.SE3,
429) -> None:
430    """
431    Sets the pose (position and orientation) of an object in a MuJoCo model, if allowed.
432
433    Parameters
434    ----------
435    model : mj.MjModel
436        The MuJoCo model containing the object.
437    data : mj.MjData
438        The simulation data where the pose is set.
439    identifier : int or str
440        The ID or name of the object.
441    obj_type : ObjType
442        The type of the object, e.g., body, joint.
443    T : sm.SE3
444        The desired pose as an SE3 transformation matrix.
445    """
446
447    assert does_exist(model, identifier, obj_type)
448
449    def set_position_and_orientation(pos, quat):
450        """Helper to set position and orientation."""
451        pos[:] = T.t
452        quat[:] = smb.r2q(T.R)
453
454    # Process based on object type
455    if obj_type is ObjType.BODY:
456        body_id = (
457            identifier
458            if isinstance(identifier, int)
459            else mj.mj_name2id(model, ObjType.BODY.value, identifier)
460        )
461
462        # Check if the body is a mocap body
463        mocap_id = model.body_mocapid[body_id]
464        if mocap_id != -1:
465            set_position_and_orientation(
466                data.mocap_pos[mocap_id], data.mocap_quat[mocap_id]
467            )
468            return
469
470        # Check if the body has a freejoint
471        if JointType(model.jnt_type[model.body_jntadr[body_id]]) is JointType.FREE:
472            jnt_id = model.body_jntadr[body_id]
473            set_position_and_orientation(
474                data.joint(jnt_id).qpos[:3], data.joint(jnt_id).qpos[3:]
475            )
476            return
477
478    elif obj_type is ObjType.JOINT:
479        joint_id = (
480            identifier
481            if isinstance(identifier, int)
482            else mj.mj_name2id(model, ObjType.JOINT.value, identifier)
483        )
484
485        # Check if the joint is a freejoint
486        if JointType(model.joint(joint_id).type[0]) is JointType.FREE:
487            set_position_and_orientation(
488                data.joint(joint_id).qpos[:3], data.joint(joint_id).qpos[3:]
489            )
490            return
491
492    # If no valid option found, raise an error
493    raise ValueError(
494        f"{obj_type.name} '{identifier}' cannot have its pose set. Only mocap bodies, bodies with freejoints, or freejoints are allowed."
495    )

Sets the pose (position and orientation) of an object in a MuJoCo model, if allowed.

Parameters

model : mj.MjModel The MuJoCo model containing the object. data : mj.MjData The simulation data where the pose is set. identifier : int or str The ID or name of the object. obj_type : ObjType The type of the object, e.g., body, joint. T : sm.SE3 The desired pose as an SE3 transformation matrix.

def get_joint_qpos_addr(model: mujoco._structs.MjModel, joint_name: Union[int, str]) -> int: 
498def get_joint_qpos_addr(model: mj.MjModel, joint_name: Union[int, str]) -> int:
499    """
500    Retrieves the address of the generalized position (qpos) for a specific joint in the MuJoCo model.
501
502    This function returns the index of the joint's generalized position in the `qpos` array
503    of the MuJoCo model. This index can be used to access or modify the joint's position
504    directly in the simulation data.
505
506    Parameters
507    ----------
508    model : mj.MjModel
509        The MuJoCo model object from which to retrieve the joint's qpos address.
510    joint_name : Union[int, str]
511        The name or ID of the joint whose qpos address is being retrieved. Can be specified
512        either as a string (name) or an integer (ID).
513
514    Returns
515    ----------
516    int
517        The address (index) of the joint's generalized position in the `qpos` array.
518
519    Notes
520    -----
521    Ensure that the specified `joint_name` corresponds to a valid joint in the MuJoCo model.
522    """
523    joint_id = (
524        joint_name
525        if isinstance(joint_name, int)
526        else name2id(model, joint_name, ObjType.JOINT)
527    )
528
529    return model.jnt_qposadr[joint_id]

def set_joint_q( data: mujoco._structs.MjData, model: mujoco._structs.MjModel, joint_name: Union[int, str], q: Union[numpy.ndarray, float], unit: str = 'rad') -> None: 
532def set_joint_q(
533    data: mj.MjData,
534    model: mj.MjModel,
535    joint_name: Union[int, str],
536    q: Union[np.ndarray, float],
537    unit: str = "rad",
538) -> None:
539    """
540    Sets the position(s) (angle(s)) of a joint in the MuJoCo simulation.
541
542    This function updates the generalized position (`qpos`) of a specified joint in
543    the MuJoCo simulation. The joint's position can be set in radians or degrees,
544    depending on the `unit` parameter. If degrees are provided, they will be converted
545    to radians before being applied. The positions are assigned to the joint's indices
546    in the `qpos` array of the simulation data.
547
548    Parameters
549    ----------
550    data : mj.MjData
551        The MuJoCo data object associated with the simulation.
552    model : mj.MjModel
553        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
554    joint_name : Union[int, str]
555        The name or ID of the joint whose position is being set.
556    q : Union[np.ndarray, float]
557        The position(s) (angle(s)) to be set for the joint. Can be a single value or an array
558        of values, depending on the type of joint.
559    unit : str, optional
560        The unit of the position value, either "rad" (radians) or "deg" (degrees). Defaults to "rad".
561
562    Returns
563    ----------
564    None
565
566    Raises
567    ------
568    ValueError
569        If the dimensions of `q` do not match the number of positions for the specified joint.
570
571    Notes
572    -----
573    - The `joint_name` can be specified as either a string (name) or an integer (ID).
574    - If the unit is "deg", the function will convert the angles from degrees to radians before applying.
575    - Ensure that the `q` values match the dimensions expected for the joint.
576    """
577    joint_name = (
578        joint_name
579        if isinstance(joint_name, int)
580        else name2id(model, joint_name, ObjType.JOINT)
581    )
582
583    # Convert q to radians if the unit is degrees
584    if unit == "deg":
585        q = np.deg2rad(q)
586
587    q_indxs = get_joint_qpos_indxs(data, model, joint_name)
588
589    # Ensure q is a numpy array
590    if isinstance(q, (int, float)):
591        q = np.array([q])
592    if isinstance(q, list):
593        q = np.array(q)
594
595    # Validate the dimensions of q
596    if q.shape[0] != len(q_indxs):
597        raise ValueError(
598            f"Dimension mismatch: Expected dimension {len(q_indxs)}, "
599            f"but got {q.shape[0]} for joint '{joint_name}'."
600        )
601
602    data.qpos[q_indxs] = q

This function updates the generalized position (qpos) of a specified joint in the MuJoCo simulation. The joint's position can be set in radians or degrees, depending on the unit parameter. If degrees are provided, they will be converted to radians before being applied. The positions are assigned to the joint's indices in the qpos array of the simulation data.

Parameters

data : mj.MjData The MuJoCo data object associated with the simulation. model : mj.MjModel The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model. joint_name : Union[int, str] The name or ID of the joint whose position is being set. q : Union[np.ndarray, float] The position(s) (angle(s)) to be set for the joint. Can be a single value or an array of values, depending on the type of joint. unit : str, optional The unit of the position value, either "rad" (radians) or "deg" (degrees). Defaults to "rad".

Returns

None

def load_keyframe( model: mujoco._structs.MjModel, data: mujoco._structs.MjData, keyframe_name: str, file_path: str, return_xml: bool = False, log: bool = True, step: bool = True) -> Optional[str]: 
 973def load_keyframe(
 974    model: mj.MjModel,
 975    data: mj.MjData,
 976    keyframe_name: str,
 977    file_path: str,
 978    return_xml: bool = False,
 979    log: bool = True,
 980    step: bool = True,
 981) -> Optional[str]:
 982    """
 983    Load a MuJoCo simulation state from a specified keyframe in an XML file or string.
 984
 985    Parameters
 986    ----------
 987    model : mj.MjModel
 988        The MuJoCo model object which defines the simulation.
 989    data : mj.MjData
 990        The MuJoCo data object to load the state into.
 991    keyframe_name : str
 992        The name of the keyframe state to load.
 993    return_xml : bool, optional
 994        If True, return the XML content as a string instead of loading it into the model. Defaults to False.
 995    file_path : str, optional
 996        Path to the XML file to load from. If None, defaults to "keyframes/<file_name>.xml".
 997    log : bool, optional
 998        Whether to log the loading action. Defaults to True.
 999    step : bool, optional
1000        Whether to step the simulation after loading the state. Defaults to True.
1001
1002    Returns
1003    -------
1004    Optional[str]
1005        If return_xml is True, returns the XML content as a string. Otherwise, returns None.
1006
1007    Raises
1008    ------
1009    ValueError
1010        If the specified state_name does not correspond to a valid keyframe.
1011    FileNotFoundError
1012        If the specified file_path does not exist.
1013    """
1014
1015    if return_xml:
1016        # Load XML content from file and return as string
1017        if os.path.exists(file_path):
1018            with open(file_path, "r") as file:
1019                xml_content = file.read()
1020            return xml_content
1021        else:
1022            print(f"File {file_path} not found.")
1023            return None
1024
1025    # Proceed with loading state from file
1026    if os.path.exists(file_path):
1027        tree = ET.parse(file_path)
1028        root = tree.getroot()
1029
1030        keyframe_element = root.find(".//keyframe")
1031        if keyframe_element is not None:
1032            try:
1033                state_id = model.keyframe(keyframe_name).id
1034            except Exception as e:
1035                raise ValueError(
1036                    f'"{keyframe_name}" does not seem to be available as a state, have you remembered to include the keyframes in your scene file? ERROR({e})'
1037                )
1038
1039            mj.mj_resetDataKeyframe(model, data, state_id)
1040            if log:
1041                print(f'Loaded : "{keyframe_name}" keyframe')
1042    else:
1043        print(f"File {file_path} not found.")
1044    if step:
1045        mj.mj_step(model, data)

Load a MuJoCo simulation state from a specified keyframe in an XML file or string.

Parameters

model : mj.MjModel The MuJoCo model object which defines the simulation. data : mj.MjData The MuJoCo data object to load the state into. keyframe_name : str The name of the keyframe state to load. return_xml : bool, optional If True, return the XML content as a string instead of loading it into the model. Defaults to False. file_path : str, optional Path to the XML file to load from. If None, defaults to "keyframes/.xml". log : bool, optional Whether to log the loading action. Defaults to True. step : bool, optional Whether to step the simulation after loading the state. Defaults to True.

Returns

Optional[str] If return_xml is True, returns the XML content as a string. Otherwise, returns None.

Raises

ValueError If the specified state_name does not correspond to a valid keyframe. FileNotFoundError If the specified file_path does not exist.

def save_keyframe( model: mujoco._structs.MjModel, data: mujoco._structs.MjData, keyframe_name: str, save_path: str) -> None: 
1048def save_keyframe(
1049    model: mj.MjModel,
1050    data: mj.MjData,
1051    keyframe_name: str,
1052    save_path: str,
1053) -> None:
1054    """
1055    Save the current state of a MuJoCo simulation to an XML file as a keyframe.
1056
1057    Parameters
1058    ----------
1059    model : mj.MjModel
1060        The MuJoCo model object.
1061    data : mj.MjData
1062        The MuJoCo data object containing the current simulation state.
1063    keyframe_name : str
1064        The name to associate with the saved state.
1065    save_path : str
1066        The file path where the keyframes XML will be saved.
1067
1068    Notes
1069    -----
1070    - If the file doesn't exist, it is created with a root `<mujoco>` tag.
1071    - If a keyframe with the same name already exists, it will be overwritten.
1072    """
1073
1074    def format_array(array) -> str:
1075        """Format a NumPy array into a space-separated string."""
1076        return " ".join(map(str, np.asarray(array).flatten()))
1077
1078    # Check if the file exists and load or initialize the XML
1079    if os.path.exists(save_path) and os.path.getsize(save_path) > 0:
1080        tree = ET.parse(save_path)
1081        root = tree.getroot()
1082    else:
1083        root = ET.Element("mujoco")
1084        tree = ET.ElementTree(root)
1085
1086    # Find or create the <keyframe> element
1087    keyframe_element = root.find("keyframe")
1088    if keyframe_element is None:
1089        keyframe_element = ET.SubElement(root, "keyframe")
1090
1091    # Check for an existing keyframe with the same name
1092    existing_key = keyframe_element.find(f"./key[@name='{keyframe_name}']")
1093    if existing_key is not None:
1094        key_element = existing_key
1095        print(f"[save_keyframe]: overwriting {key_element}")
1096    else:
1097        key_element = ET.SubElement(keyframe_element, "key")
1098        key_element.set("name", keyframe_name)
1099
1100    # Update the keyframe attributes
1101    key_element.set("time", f"{data.time:.6f}")
1102    key_element.set("qpos", format_array(data.qpos))
1103    key_element.set("qvel", format_array(data.qvel))
1104    key_element.set("ctrl", format_array(data.ctrl))
1105    key_element.set("mpos", format_array(data.mocap_pos))
1106    key_element.set("mquat", format_array(data.mocap_quat))
1107
1108    # Save the updated XML to file
1109    os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(save_path), exist_ok=True)
1110    with open(save_path, "w", encoding="utf-8") as file:
1111        rough_string = ET.tostring(root, encoding="utf-8")
1112        reparsed = minidom.parseString(rough_string)
1113        file.write(reparsed.toprettyxml(indent="    "))
1114
1115    print(f"Saved keyframe '{keyframe_name}' to '{save_path}'.")

Save the current state of a MuJoCo simulation to an XML file as a keyframe.

Parameters

model : mj.MjModel The MuJoCo model object. data : mj.MjData The MuJoCo data object containing the current simulation state. keyframe_name : str The name to associate with the saved state. save_path : str The file path where the keyframes XML will be saved.

Notes

  • If the file doesn't exist, it is created with a root <mujoco> tag.
  • If a keyframe with the same name already exists, it will be overwritten.
def apply_wrench( data: mujoco._structs.MjData, model: mujoco._structs.MjModel, body_name: str, wrench: Union[numpy.ndarray, List, Tuple]) -> None: 
1118def apply_wrench(
1119    data: mj.MjData,
1120    model: mj.MjModel,
1121    body_name: str,
1122    wrench: Union[np.ndarray, List, Tuple],
1123) -> None:
1124    """
1125    Applies a wrench (force and torque) to a specific body in the MuJoCo simulation.
1126
1127    The wrench is a 6-dimensional vector that includes both force (fx, fy, fz) and torque (tx, ty, tz).
1128    This function allows you to apply the wrench to a body in the simulation using its name.
1129
1130    Parameters
1131    ----------
1132    data : mj.MjData
1133        The MuJoCo data object associated with the current simulation state.
1134    model : mj.MjModel
1135        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
1136    body_name : str
1137        The name of the body to which the wrench will be applied.
1138    wrench : Union[np.ndarray, List, Tuple]
1139        The wrench to be applied, provided as a 6-dimensional vector in any of the following formats:
1140        - numpy array
1141        - list
1142        - tuple
1143
1144    Returns
1145    -------
1146    None
1147
1148    Raises
1149    ------
1150    ValueError
1151        If the wrench is not a 6-dimensional vector or if the body name does not exist in the model.
1152    TypeError
1153        If the wrench is not a type that can be converted to a numpy array.
1154    """
1155
1156    # Ensure the wrench is a numpy array
1157    if isinstance(wrench, (list, tuple)):
1158        try:
1159            wrench = np.array(wrench)
1160        except Exception as e:
1161            raise TypeError(f"Unable to convert wrench to numpy array: {e}")
1162
1163    # Validate the wrench dimensions
1164    if wrench.shape != (6,):
1165        raise ValueError(
1166            "The wrench must be a 6-dimensional vector [fx, fy, fz, tx, ty, tz]."
1167        )
1168
1169    # Get the body ID
1170    try:
1171        target_id = name2id(model, body_name, ObjType.BODY)
1172    except Exception:
1173        raise ValueError(f"The body name '{body_name}' does not exist in the model.")
1174
1175    # Apply the wrench to the specified body
1176    data.xfrc_applied[target_id, :] = wrench

def get_geoms_in_contact( data: mujoco._structs.MjData, model: mujoco._structs.MjModel) -> List[Tuple[str, str]]: 
1179def get_geoms_in_contact(data: mj.MjData, model: mj.MjModel) -> List[Tuple[str, str]]:
1180    """
1181    Retrieve a list of geometry pairs currently in contact in the MuJoCo simulation.
1182
1183    This function iterates through all contacts in the MuJoCo simulation data and
1184    collects the names of geometries that are in contact. It returns a list of tuples,
1185    where each tuple contains the names of two geometries that are in contact.
1186
1187    Args
1188    ----------
1189    data : mj.MjData
1190        The MuJoCo data object containing the current state of the simulation.
1191    model : mj.MjModel
1192        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
1193
1194    Returns
1195    ----------
1196    List[Tuple[str, str]]:
1197        A list of tuples, where each tuple contains the names of two geometries that are in contact.
1198
1199    Notes
1200    ----------
1201    Ensure that the MuJoCo model and data are correctly initialized before calling this function.
1202    The function assumes that all contact pairs are relevant and does not filter them.
1203    """
1204    contact_states = []
1205
1206    for i in range(data.ncon):
1207        contact = data.contact[i]
1208        geom1_name = id2name(model, contact.geom1, ObjType.GEOM)
1209        geom2_name = id2name(model, contact.geom2, ObjType.GEOM)
1210        contact_states.append((geom1_name, geom2_name))
1211
1212    return contact_states

def get_geom_distance( data: mujoco._structs.MjData, model: mujoco._structs.MjModel, geom1: Union[int, str], geom2: Union[int, str], distmax: float = 10.0) -> Tuple[float, numpy.ndarray]: 
1277def get_geom_distance(
1278    data: mj.MjData,
1279    model: mj.MjModel,
1280    geom1: Union[int, str],
1281    geom2: Union[int, str],
1282    distmax: float = 10.0,
1283) -> Tuple[float, np.ndarray]:
1284    """
1285    Calculate the smallest signed distance between two geometries (geoms) and the segment from one geom to the other.
1286
1287    This function computes the distance between two specified geoms and provides the segment vector between them.
1288    The distance is computed within a specified maximum distance, `distmax`. If the distance is greater than
1289    `distmax`, the function will return `distmax`.
1290
1291    Args:
1292    ----------
1293    data : mj.MjData
1294        The MuJoCo data object containing the current state of the simulation.
1295    model : mj.MjModel
1296        The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model.
1297    geom1 : Union[int, str]
1298        The ID or name of the first geometry.
1299    geom2 : Union[int, str]
1300        The ID or name of the second geometry.
1301    distmax : float, optional
1302        The maximum distance for the distance calculation. Defaults to 10.0.
1303
1304    Returns:
1305    ----------
1306    Tuple[float, np.ndarray]
1307        A tuple where the first element is the smallest signed distance between the two geoms, and the second
1308        element is the segment vector from `geom1` to `geom2`.
1309
1310    Raises:
1311    ----------
1312    ValueError
1313        If `geom1` or `geom2` is not a valid geometry ID or name, or if `distmax` is not a positive number.
1314
1315    Notes:
1316    ----------
1317    - Ensure that both `geom1` and `geom2` are valid geometry IDs or names within the MuJoCo model.
1318    - The distance calculation is sensitive to the model and simulation state. Ensure that the simulation is updated
1319      if necessary before calling this function.
1320    """
1321
1322    if not isinstance(distmax, (int, float)) or distmax <= 0:
1323        raise ValueError(
1324            f"Invalid `distmax` value: {distmax}. It must be a positive number."
1325        )
1326
1327    # Convert geom names to IDs if necessary
1328    geom1 = name2id(model, geom1, ObjType.GEOM) if isinstance(geom1, str) else geom1
1329    geom2 = name2id(model, geom2, ObjType.GEOM) if isinstance(geom2, str) else geom2
1330
1331    # Initialize the segment vector
1332    from_to = np.zeros(6)
1333
1334    # Calculate the distance and segment
1335    distance = mj.mj_geomDistance(model, data, geom1, geom2, distmax, from_to)
1336
1337    _from = from_to[:3]
1338    _to = from_to[3:]
1339
1340    return distance, _from, _to

Calculate the smallest signed distance between two geometries (geoms) and the segment from one geom to the other.

This function computes the distance between two specified geoms and provides the segment vector between them. The distance is computed within a specified maximum distance, distmax. If the distance is greater than distmax, the function will return distmax.

Args:

data : mj.MjData The MuJoCo data object containing the current state of the simulation. model : mj.MjModel The MuJoCo model object containing the simulation model. geom1 : Union[int, str] The ID or name of the first geometry. geom2 : Union[int, str] The ID or name of the second geometry. distmax : float, optional The maximum distance for the distance calculation. Defaults to 10.0.

Returns:

Tuple[float, np.ndarray] A tuple where the first element is the smallest signed distance between the two geoms, and the second element is the segment vector from geom1 to geom2.

Raises:

ValueError If geom1 or geom2 is not a valid geometry ID or name, or if distmax is not a positive number.

Notes:

  • Ensure that both geom1 and geom2 are valid geometry IDs or names within the MuJoCo model.
  • The distance calculation is sensitive to the model and simulation state. Ensure that the simulation is updated if necessary before calling this function.

1344class ContactState:
1345    """
1346    A class to represent the state of a contact in a MuJoCo simulation.
1347
1348    Attributes

1350    H : np.ndarray

1353        The contact space dimensionality: 1, 3, 4, or 6.
1354    dist : float
1355        The distance between the nearest points; negative values indicate penetration.
1356    efc_address : int

1358    elem : np.ndarray
1359        A 2-element array of integers representing element IDs; -1 for geom or flex vertex.
1360    exclude : int
1361        Exclusion flag for the contact: 0 (include), 1 (in gap), 2 (fused), 3 (no dofs).
1362    flex : np.ndarray
1363        A 2-element array of integers representing flex IDs; -1 for geom.
1364    frame : np.ndarray
1365        A 9-element array representing the contact frame. The normal is in [0-2] and points from geom[0] to geom[1].
1366    friction : np.ndarray
1367        A 5-element array representing friction parameters: tangent1, 2, spin, roll1, roll2.
1368    geom : np.ndarray
1369        A 2-element array of integers representing the IDs of the geometries in contact; -1 for flex.
1370    geom1 : int
1371        The first geometry index.
1372    geom2 : int

1374    geom_names : np.ndarray

1376    geom1_name : str
1377        The name of the first geometry.
1378    geom2_name : str
1379        The name of the second geometry.
1380    includemargin : float
1381        The inclusion margin for the contact; includes if dist < includemargin = margin - gap.
1382    mu : float
1383        The coefficient of friction.
1384    pos : np.ndarray
1385        A 3-element array representing the position of the contact point, typically the midpoint between geometries.
1386    solimp : np.ndarray
1387        A 5-element array for solver impedance parameters.
1388    solref : np.ndarray
1389        A 2-element array for solver reference parameters for the normal direction.
1390    solreffriction : np.ndarray
1391        A 2-element array for solver reference parameters related to friction directions.
1392    vert : np.ndarray
1393        A 2-element array of integers representing vertex IDs; -1 for geom or flex element.

1396    model : mj.MjModel
1397        The MuJoCo model object.
1398    data : mj.MjData
1399        The MuJoCo data object.
1400    c_wrench : np.ndarray
1401        A 6-element array representing the wrench (force and torque) at the contact in the contact frame.
1402    w_wrench : np.ndarray
1403        A 6-element array representing the wrench (force and torque) at the contact in the world frame.
1404
1405    Methods
1406    -------
1407    _compute_wrench():

1412

1415    """

1447    def __repr__(self):
1448        s = f"{type(self).__name__}(\n\t{self.pos=},\n\t{self.c_wrench=},\n\t{self.w_wrench=},\n\t{self.geom=},\n\t{self.geom_names=}\n)"

1450
1451    def __post_init__(self):
1452        self.c_wrench = self._compute_wrench()
1453        self.w_wrench = self._transform_wrench_to_global(self.c_wrench)
1454        self.geom1_name = id2name(self.model, self.geom1, ObjType.GEOM)
1455        self.geom2_name = id2name(self.model, self.geom2, ObjType.GEOM)
1456        self.geom_names = np.array([self.geom1_name, self.geom2_name])
1457
1458    def _compute_wrench(self):
1459        c_array = np.zeros(6, dtype=np.float64)
1460        if self.index >= 0 and self.model is not None and self.data is not None:
1461            mj.mj_contactForce(self.model, self.data, self.index, c_array)
1462        return c_array
1463
1464    def _transform_wrench_to_global(self, wrench: np.ndarray):
1465        # Contact frame as 3x3 matrix
1466        contact_frame = self.frame.reshape(3, 3)
1467        w_wrench = np.ones_like(wrench)
1468        # Transform force (first 3 elements of wrench)
1469        w_wrench[:3] = contact_frame.T @ wrench[:3]
1470        w_wrench[3:] = contact_frame.T @ wrench[3:]
1471        return w_wrench

1579    def print(self) -> None:
1580        """
1581        Print the robot's information in a formatted and indented list.
1582
1583        This method outputs the robot's detailed information, including base body name,
1584        number of bodies, actuators, joints, geometries, joint limits, and actuator limits.
1585        Each component's name and ID are listed with proper indentation to provide a clear,
1586        organized view of the robot's structure and components.
1587        """
1588        print(f"Robot Name: {self.name}")
1589        print(f"Number of Bodies: {len(self.body_names)}")
1590        print(f"Number of Actuators: {self.n_actuators}")
1591        print(f"Number of Joints: {self.n_joints}")
1592        print(f"Number of Geometries: {len(self.geom_names)}\n")
1593
1594        print("Bodies:")
1595        for i, body_name in enumerate(self.body_names):
1596            print(f"  {i + 1}. {body_name} (ID: {self.body_ids[i]})")
1597
1598        print("\nActuators:")
1599        for i, actuator_name in enumerate(self.actuator_names):
1600            print(f"  {i + 1}. {actuator_name} (ID: {self.actuator_ids[i]})")
1601
1602        print("\nJoints:")
1603        for i, joint_name in enumerate(self.joint_names):
1604            print(f"  {i + 1}. {joint_name} (ID: {self.joint_ids[i]})")
1605
1606        print("\nJoint Limits (min, max):")
1607        for i, (joint_name, limits) in enumerate(
1608            zip(self.joint_names, self.joint_limits.T)
1609        ):
1610            print(f"  {i + 1}. {joint_name}: {limits[0]:.2f}, {limits[1]:.2f}")
1611
1612        print("\nActuator Limits (min, max):")
1613        for i, (actuator_name, limits) in enumerate(
1614            zip(self.actuator_names, self.actuator_limits.T)

1617
1618        print("\nGeometries:")

1621
1622        print("\nSites:")

1624            print(f"  {i + 1}. {site_name} (ID: {self.site_ids[i]})")

def get_contact_states( data: mujoco._structs.MjData, model: mujoco._structs.MjModel, geom_names1: Union[int, str, List[Union[int, str]], numpy.ndarray] = None, geom_names2: Union[int, str, List[Union[int, str]], numpy.ndarray] = None) -> Tuple[bool, List[ContactState]]: 
1799def get_contact_states(
1800    data: mj.MjData,
1801    model: mj.MjModel,
1802    geom_names1: Union[int, str, List[Union[int, str]], np.ndarray] = None,
1803    geom_names2: Union[int, str, List[Union[int, str]], np.ndarray] = None,
1804) -> Tuple[bool, List[ContactState]]:
1805    """
1806    Retrieves the contact states for specified geometries in the MuJoCo simulation.
1807
1808    Parameters
1809    ----------
1810    data : mj.MjData
1811        The MuJoCo data object containing the current state of the simulation, including contact information.
1812    model : mj.MjModel
1813        The MuJoCo model object, which defines the structure of the simulation including geometries.
1814    geom_names1 : Union[int, str, List[int], List[str], np.ndarray], optional
1815        The name or ID of the first geometry (or a list/array of them) to check for contact.
1816        If provided, the function filters the contact states to include only those involving this geometry.
1817        Default is None.
1818    geom_names2 : Union[int, str, List[int], List[str], np.ndarray], optional
1819        The name or ID of the second geometry (or a list/array of them) to check for contact.
1820        If provided, the function filters the contact states to include only those involving both specified geometries.
1821        Default is None.
1822
1823    Returns
1824    -------
1825    Tuple[bool, List[ContactState]]
1826        - A boolean indicating whether any contact was found (`True` if there are contact states, `False` otherwise).
1827        - A list of ContactState objects representing the states of the contacts in the simulation.
1828
1829    Notes
1830    -----
1831    - If both `geom_names1` and `geom_names2` are provided, the function returns only the contacts involving both geometries.
1832    - If only one geometry (either name or ID or list of them) is provided, the function returns all contacts involving that geometry.
1833    - If no geometry names or IDs are provided, the function returns all contact states in the simulation.
1834
1835    Examples
1836    --------
1837    # Example 1: Get all contact states in the simulation
1838    in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model)
1839
1840    # Example 2: Get contact states involving a specific geometry by name
1841    in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model, geom_names1='geom1')
1842
1843    # Example 3: Get contact states involving two specific geometries by IDs
1844    in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model, geom_names1=3, geom_names2=5)
1845
1846    # Example 4: Get contact states involving any of multiple geometries
1847    in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model, geom_names1=['geom1', 'geom2'])
1848
1849    # Example 5: Get contact states involving pairs of geometries from two lists
1850    in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model, geom_names1=[3, 5], geom_names2=['geom6', 'geom7'])
1851    """
1852
1853    def get_geom_ids(geom_names):
1854        """Helper function to convert names/IDs to a list of geometry IDs."""
1855        if geom_names is None:
1856            return None
1857        if isinstance(geom_names, (int, str)):
1858            geom_names = [geom_names]  # Convert single value to list
1859        return [
1860            geom if isinstance(geom, int) else name2id(model, geom, ObjType.GEOM)
1861            for geom in geom_names
1862        ]
1863
1864    geom_ids1 = get_geom_ids(geom_names1)
1865    geom_ids2 = get_geom_ids(geom_names2)
1866
1867    # Get all contact states
1868    contact_states: List[ContactState] = []
1869    for i in range(data.ncon):
1870        contact = data.contact[i]
1871        cs = ContactState.from_mjcontact(contact, data, model, i)
1872        contact_states.append(cs)
1873
1874    # Filter contacts based on the provided geometry names or IDs
1875    if geom_ids1 is not None:
1876        contact_states = [
1877            cs
1878            for cs in contact_states
1879            if cs.geom1 in geom_ids1 or cs.geom2 in geom_ids1
1880        ]
1881
1882    if geom_ids2 is not None:
1883        contact_states = [
1884            cs
1885            for cs in contact_states
1886            if (cs.geom1 in geom_ids2 or cs.geom2 in geom_ids2)
1887            and (geom_ids1 is None or cs.geom1 in geom_ids1 or cs.geom2 in geom_ids1)
1888        ]
1889
1890    in_contact = len(contact_states) != 0
1891
1892    return in_contact, contact_states

Retrieves the contact states for specified geometries in the MuJoCo simulation.

Parameters

data : mj.MjData The MuJoCo data object containing the current state of the simulation, including contact information. model : mj.MjModel The MuJoCo model object, which defines the structure of the simulation including geometries. geom_names1 : Union[int, str, List[int], List[str], np.ndarray], optional The name or ID of the first geometry (or a list/array of them) to check for contact. If provided, the function filters the contact states to include only those involving this geometry. Default is None. geom_names2 : Union[int, str, List[int], List[str], np.ndarray], optional The name or ID of the second geometry (or a list/array of them) to check for contact. If provided, the function filters the contact states to include only those involving both specified geometries. Default is None.

Returns

Tuple[bool, List[ContactState]] - A boolean indicating whether any contact was found (True if there are contact states, False otherwise). - A list of ContactState objects representing the states of the contacts in the simulation.

Notes

  • If both geom_names1 and geom_names2 are provided, the function returns only the contacts involving both geometries.
  • If only one geometry (either name or ID or list of them) is provided, the function returns all contacts involving that geometry.
  • If no geometry names or IDs are provided, the function returns all contact states in the simulation.

Examples

Example 1: Get all contact states in the simulation

in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model)

Example 2: Get contact states involving a specific geometry by name

in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model, geom_names1='geom1')

Example 3: Get contact states involving two specific geometries by IDs

in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model, geom_names1=3, geom_names2=5)

Example 4: Get contact states involving any of multiple geometries

in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model, geom_names1=['geom1', 'geom2'])

Example 5: Get contact states involving pairs of geometries from two lists

in_contact, contact_states = get_contact_states(data, model, geom_names1=[3, 5], geom_names2=['geom6', 'geom7'])
